rows.arabic: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ
rows.translation: In the name of Allah, the Beneficent, the Merciful.
rows.transliteration: bismillāhir raḥmānir raḥīm

rows.arabic: الٓمٓ
rows.translation: Alif Lam Mim.
rows.transliteration: alif lām mīm

rows.arabic: ٱللَّهُ لَآ إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ ٱلْحَىُّ ٱلْقَيُّومُ
rows.translation: Allah, (there is) no god but He, the Everliving, the Self-subsisting by Whom all things subsist
rows.transliteration: allāhu lā ilāha illā huwal ḥayyul qayyūm

rows.arabic: نَزَّلَ عَلَيْكَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ بِٱلْحَقِّ مُصَدِّقًا لِّمَا بَيْنَ يَدَيْهِ وَأَنزَلَ ٱلتَّوْرَىٰةَ وَٱلْإِنجِيلَ
rows.translation: He has revealed to you the Book with truth, verifying that which is before it, and He revealed the Tavrat and the Injeel aforetime, a guidance for the people, and He sent the Furqan.
rows.transliteration: nazzala `alaykal kitāba bil ḥaqqi muṣaddiqal limā bayna yadayhi wa-anzalat tawrāta wal-injīl

rows.arabic: مِن قَبْلُ هُدًى لِّلنَّاسِ وَأَنزَلَ ٱلْفُرْقَانَ ۗ إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ بِـَٔايَـٰتِ ٱللَّهِ لَهُمْ عَذَابٌ شَدِيدٌ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ عَزِيزٌ ذُو ٱنتِقَامٍ
rows.translation: Surely they who disbelieve in the communications of Allah they shall have a severe chastisement; and Allah is Mighty, the Lord of retribution.
rows.transliteration: min qablu hudan linnāsi wa-anzalal-furqān ۗ innal ladhīna kafarū bi-āyātillāhi lahum `adhābun shadīd ۗ wallāhu `azīzun dhun-tiqām

rows.arabic: إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَا يَخْفَىٰ عَلَيْهِ شَىْءٌ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَلَا فِى ٱلسَّمَآءِ
rows.translation: Allah-- surely nothing is hidden from Him in the earth or in the heaven.
rows.transliteration: innallāha lā yakhfā `alayhi shay-un fil-arḍi walā fis samā-i

rows.arabic: هُوَ ٱلَّذِى يُصَوِّرُكُمْ فِى ٱلْأَرْحَامِ كَيْفَ يَشَآءُ ۚ لَآ إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْحَكِيمُ
rows.translation: He it is Who shapes you in the wombs as He likes; there is no god but He, the Mighty, the Wise
rows.transliteration: huwal ladhī yuṣawwirukum fil-arḥāmi kayfa yashā-u ۚ lā ilāha illā huwal `azīzul ḥakīm

rows.arabic: هُوَ ٱلَّذِىٓ أَنزَلَ عَلَيْكَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ مِنْهُ ءَايَـٰتٌ مُّحْكَمَـٰتٌ هُنَّ أُمُّ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ وَأُخَرُ مُتَشَـٰبِهَـٰتٌ ۖ فَأَمَّا ٱلَّذِينَ فِى قُلُوبِهِمْ زَيْغٌ فَيَتَّبِعُونَ مَا تَشَـٰبَهَ مِنْهُ ٱبْتِغَآءَ ٱلْفِتْنَةِ وَٱبْتِغَآءَ تَأْوِيلِهِۦ ۗ وَمَا يَعْلَمُ تَأْوِيلَهُۥٓ إِلَّا ٱللَّهُ ۗ وَٱلرَّٰسِخُونَ فِى ٱلْعِلْمِ يَقُولُونَ ءَامَنَّا بِهِۦ كُلٌّ مِّنْ عِندِ رَبِّنَا ۗ وَمَا يَذَّكَّرُ إِلَّآ أُو۟لُوا۟ ٱلْأَلْبَـٰبِ
rows.translation: He it is Who has revealed the Book to you; some of its verses are decisive, they are the basis of the Book, and others are allegorical; then as for those in whose hearts there is perversity they follow the part of it which is allegorical, seeking to mislead and seeking to give it (their own) interpretation. but none knows its interpretation except Allah, and those who are firmly rooted in knowledge say: We believe in it, it is all from our Lord; and none do mind except those having understanding.
rows.transliteration: huwal ladhī anzala `alaykal kitāba minhu āyātun muḥkamātun hunna ummul kitābi wa-ukharu mutashābihāt ۖ fa-ammal ladhīna fī qulūbihim zayghun fayattabi`ūna mā tashābaha minhub-tighā-al fitnati wabtighā-a ta-wīlih ۗ wa mā ya`lamu ta-wīlahu illallāh ۗ war rāsikhūna fil `il-mi yaqūlūna āmannā bihi kullun min `indi rabbinā ۗ wa mā yadhhakkaru illā ulul-albāb

rows.arabic: رَبَّنَا لَا تُزِغْ قُلُوبَنَا بَعْدَ إِذْ هَدَيْتَنَا وَهَبْ لَنَا مِن لَّدُنكَ رَحْمَةً ۚ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ ٱلْوَهَّابُ
rows.translation: Our Lord! make not our hearts to deviate after Thou hast guided us aright, and grant us from Thee mercy; surely Thou art the most liberal Giver.
rows.transliteration: rabbanā lā tuzigh qulūbanā ba`da idh hadaytanā wahab lanā min ladunka raḥmah ۚ innaka antal wahhāb

rows.arabic: رَبَّنَآ إِنَّكَ جَامِعُ ٱلنَّاسِ لِيَوْمٍ لَّا رَيْبَ فِيهِ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَا يُخْلِفُ ٱلْمِيعَادَ
rows.translation: Our Lord! surely Thou art the Gatherer of men on a day about which there is no doubt; surely Allah will not fail (His) promise.
rows.transliteration: rabbanā innaka jāmi`un nāsi liyawmin lā rayba fīh ۚ innallāha lā yukhliful mī`ād

rows.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لَن تُغْنِىَ عَنْهُمْ أَمْوَٰلُهُمْ وَلَآ أَوْلَـٰدُهُم مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ شَيْـًٔا ۖ وَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ هُمْ وَقُودُ ٱلنَّارِ
rows.translation: (As for) those who disbelieve, surely neither their wealth nor their children shall avail them in the least against Allah, and these it is who are the fuel of the fire.
rows.transliteration: innal ladhīna kafarū lan tughniya `anhum amwāluhum walā awlāduhum minallāhi shay-ā ۖ wa-ulā-ika hum waqūdun nār

rows.arabic: كَدَأْبِ ءَالِ فِرْعَوْنَ وَٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِمْ ۚ كَذَّبُوا۟ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَا فَأَخَذَهُمُ ٱللَّهُ بِذُنُوبِهِمْ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ شَدِيدُ ٱلْعِقَابِ
rows.translation: Like the striving of the people of Firon and those before them; they rejected Our communications, so Allah destroyed them on account of their faults; and Allah is severe in requiting (evil).
rows.transliteration: kada-bi āli fir`awna wal ladhīna min qablihim ۚ kadhhabū bi-āyātinā fa-akhadhahumullāhu bidhunūbihim ۗ wallāhu shadīdul `iqāb

rows.arabic: قُل لِّلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ سَتُغْلَبُونَ وَتُحْشَرُونَ إِلَىٰ جَهَنَّمَ ۚ وَبِئْسَ ٱلْمِهَادُ
rows.translation: Say to those who disbelieve: You shall be vanquished, and driven together to hell; and evil is the resting-place.
rows.transliteration: qul lilladhīna kafarū satughlabūna watuḥsharūna ilā jahannam ۚ wabi-sal mihād

rows.arabic: قَدْ كَانَ لَكُمْ ءَايَةٌ فِى فِئَتَيْنِ ٱلْتَقَتَا ۖ فِئَةٌ تُقَـٰتِلُ فِى سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ وَأُخْرَىٰ كَافِرَةٌ يَرَوْنَهُم مِّثْلَيْهِمْ رَأْىَ ٱلْعَيْنِ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ يُؤَيِّدُ بِنَصْرِهِۦ مَن يَشَآءُ ۗ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَعِبْرَةً لِّأُو۟لِى ٱلْأَبْصَـٰرِ
rows.translation: Indeed there was a sign for you in the two hosts (which) met together in encounter; one party fighting in the way of Allah and the other unbelieving, whom they saw twice as many as themselves with the sight of the eye and Allah strengthens with His aid whom He pleases; most surely there is a lesson in this for those who have sight.
rows.transliteration: qad kāna lakum āyatun fī fi-ataynil taqatā ۖ fi-atun tuqātilu fī sabīlillāhi wa-ukhrā kāfiratun yarawnahum mithlayhim ra-yal `ayn ۚ wallāhu yu-ayyidu binaṣrihi man yashā-u ۗ inna fī dhālika la`ibratan li-ulil-abṣār

rows.arabic: زُيِّنَ لِلنَّاسِ حُبُّ ٱلشَّهَوَٰتِ مِنَ ٱلنِّسَآءِ وَٱلْبَنِينَ وَٱلْقَنَـٰطِيرِ ٱلْمُقَنطَرَةِ مِنَ ٱلذَّهَبِ وَٱلْفِضَّةِ وَٱلْخَيْلِ ٱلْمُسَوَّمَةِ وَٱلْأَنْعَـٰمِ وَٱلْحَرْثِ ۗ ذَٰلِكَ مَتَـٰعُ ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا ۖ وَٱللَّهُ عِندَهُۥ حُسْنُ ٱلْمَـَٔابِ
rows.translation: The love of desires, of women and sons and hoarded treasures of gold and silver and well bred horses and cattle and tilth, is made to seem fair to men; this is the provision of the life of this world; and Allah is He with Whom is the good goal (of life).
rows.transliteration: zuyyina linnāsi ḥubbush shahawāti minan nisā-i wal banīna wal qanāṭīril muqanṭarati minadh dhahabi wal fiḍḍati wal khaylil musawwamati wal-an`āmi wal ḥarth ۗ dhālika matā`ul ḥayātid dunyā ۖ wallāhu `indahu ḥusnul ma-āb

rows.arabic: قُلْ أَؤُنَبِّئُكُم بِخَيْرٍ مِّن ذَٰلِكُمْ ۚ لِلَّذِينَ ٱتَّقَوْا۟ عِندَ رَبِّهِمْ جَنَّـٰتٌ تَجْرِى مِن تَحْتِهَا ٱلْأَنْهَـٰرُ خَـٰلِدِينَ فِيهَا وَأَزْوَٰجٌ مُّطَهَّرَةٌ وَرِضْوَٰنٌ مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ بَصِيرٌۢ بِٱلْعِبَادِ
rows.translation: Say: Shall I tell you what is better than these? For those who guard (against evil) are gardens with their Lord, beneath which rivers flow, to abide in them, and pure mates and Allah's pleasure; and Allah sees the servants.
rows.transliteration: qul a-unabbi-ukum bikhayrin min dhālikum ۚ lilladhīnat-taqaw `inda rabbihim jannātun tajrī min taḥtihal-anhāru khālidīna fīhā wa-azwājun muṭahharatun wariḍwānun minallāh ۗ wallāhu baṣīrun bil `ibād

rows.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ يَقُولُونَ رَبَّنَآ إِنَّنَآ ءَامَنَّا فَٱغْفِرْ لَنَا ذُنُوبَنَا وَقِنَا عَذَابَ ٱلنَّارِ
rows.translation: Those who say: Our Lord! surely we believe, therefore forgive us our faults and save us from the chastisement of the fire.
rows.transliteration: alladhīna yaqūlūna rabbanā innanā āmannā faghfir lanā dhunūbanā waqinā `adhāban nār

rows.arabic: ٱلصَّـٰبِرِينَ وَٱلصَّـٰدِقِينَ وَٱلْقَـٰنِتِينَ وَٱلْمُنفِقِينَ وَٱلْمُسْتَغْفِرِينَ بِٱلْأَسْحَارِ
rows.translation: The patient, and the truthful, and the obedient, and those who spend (benevolently) and those who ask forgiveness in the morning times.
rows.transliteration: aṣ-ṣābirīna waṣ ṣādiqīna wal qānitīna wal munfiqīna wal mustaghfirīna bil-as-ḥār

rows.arabic: شَهِدَ ٱللَّهُ أَنَّهُۥ لَآ إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ وَٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةُ وَأُو۟لُوا۟ ٱلْعِلْمِ قَآئِمًۢا بِٱلْقِسْطِ ۚ لَآ إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْحَكِيمُ
rows.translation: Allah bears witness that there is no god but He, and (so do) the angels and those possessed of knowledge, maintaining His creation with justice; there is no god but He, the Mighty, the Wise.
rows.transliteration: shahidallāhu annahu lā ilāha illā huwa wal malā-ikatu wa-ulul `il-mi qā-iman bil qisṭ ۚ lā ilāha illā huwal `azīzul ḥakīm

rows.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلدِّينَ عِندَ ٱللَّهِ ٱلْإِسْلَـٰمُ ۗ وَمَا ٱخْتَلَفَ ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُوا۟ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ إِلَّا مِنۢ بَعْدِ مَا جَآءَهُمُ ٱلْعِلْمُ بَغْيًۢا بَيْنَهُمْ ۗ وَمَن يَكْفُرْ بِـَٔايَـٰتِ ٱللَّهِ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ سَرِيعُ ٱلْحِسَابِ
rows.translation: Surely the (true) religion with Allah is Islam, and those to whom the Book had been given did not show opposition but after knowledge had come to them, out of envy among themselves; and whoever disbelieves in the communications of Allah then surely Allah is quick in reckoning.
rows.transliteration: innad dīna `indallāhil-islām ۗ wa makh-talafal ladhīna ūtul kitāba illā min ba`di mā jā-ahumul `il-mu baghyan baynahum ۗ wa man yakfur bi-āyātillāhi fa-innallāha sarī`ul ḥisāb

rows.arabic: فَإِنْ حَآجُّوكَ فَقُلْ أَسْلَمْتُ وَجْهِىَ لِلَّهِ وَمَنِ ٱتَّبَعَنِ ۗ وَقُل لِّلَّذِينَ أُوتُوا۟ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ وَٱلْأُمِّيِّـۧنَ ءَأَسْلَمْتُمْ ۚ فَإِنْ أَسْلَمُوا۟ فَقَدِ ٱهْتَدَوا۟ ۖ وَّإِن تَوَلَّوْا۟ فَإِنَّمَا عَلَيْكَ ٱلْبَلَـٰغُ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ بَصِيرٌۢ بِٱلْعِبَادِ
rows.translation: But if they dispute with you, say: I have submitted myself entirely to Allah and (so) every one who follows me; and say to those who have been given the Book and the unlearned people: Do you submit yourselves? So if they submit then indeed they follow the right way; and if they turn back, then upon you is only the delivery of the message and Allah sees the servants.
rows.transliteration: fa-in ḥājjūka faqul aslamtu wajhiya lillāhi wa manit-taba`an ۗ waqul lilladhīna ūtul kitāba wal-ummiyyīna a-aslamtum ۚ fa-in aslamū faqadih-tadaw ۖ wa in tawallaw fa-innamā `alaykal balāgh ۗ wallāhu baṣīrun bil `ibād

rows.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ يَكْفُرُونَ بِـَٔايَـٰتِ ٱللَّهِ وَيَقْتُلُونَ ٱلنَّبِيِّـۧنَ بِغَيْرِ حَقٍّ وَيَقْتُلُونَ ٱلَّذِينَ يَأْمُرُونَ بِٱلْقِسْطِ مِنَ ٱلنَّاسِ فَبَشِّرْهُم بِعَذَابٍ أَلِيمٍ
rows.translation: Surely (as for) those who disbelieve in the communications of Allah and slay the prophets unjustly and slay those among men who enjoin justice, announce to them a painful chastisement.
rows.transliteration: innal ladhīna yakfurūna bi-āyātillāhi wayaqtulūnan nabiyyīna bighayri ḥaqqin wayaqtulūnal ladhīna ya-murūna bil qisṭi minan nāsi fabashhirhum bi`adhābin alīm

rows.arabic: أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ ٱلَّذِينَ حَبِطَتْ أَعْمَـٰلُهُمْ فِى ٱلدُّنْيَا وَٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ وَمَا لَهُم مِّن نَّـٰصِرِينَ
rows.translation: Those are they whose works shall become null in this world as well as the hereafter, and they shall have no helpers.
rows.transliteration: ulā-ikal ladhīna ḥabiṭat a`māluhum fid dunyā wal-ākhirati wa mā lahum min nāṣirīn

rows.arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَ إِلَى ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُوا۟ نَصِيبًا مِّنَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ يُدْعَوْنَ إِلَىٰ كِتَـٰبِ ٱللَّهِ لِيَحْكُمَ بَيْنَهُمْ ثُمَّ يَتَوَلَّىٰ فَرِيقٌ مِّنْهُمْ وَهُم مُّعْرِضُونَ
rows.translation: Have you not considered those (Jews) who are given a portion of the Book? They are invited to the Book of Allah that it might decide between them, then a part of them turn back and they withdraw.
rows.transliteration: alam tara ilal ladhīna ūtū naṣīban minal kitābi yud`awna ilā kitābillāhi liyaḥkuma baynahum thumma yatawallā farīqun minhum wahum mu`riḍūn

rows.arabic: ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُمْ قَالُوا۟ لَن تَمَسَّنَا ٱلنَّارُ إِلَّآ أَيَّامًا مَّعْدُودَٰتٍ ۖ وَغَرَّهُمْ فِى دِينِهِم مَّا كَانُوا۟ يَفْتَرُونَ
rows.translation: This is because they say: The fire shall not touch us but for a few days; and what they have forged deceives them in the matter of their religion.
rows.transliteration: dhālika bi-annahum qālū lan tamassanan nāru illā ayyāman ma`dūdāt ۖ wagharrahum fī dīnihim mā kānū yaftarūn

rows.arabic: فَكَيْفَ إِذَا جَمَعْنَـٰهُمْ لِيَوْمٍ لَّا رَيْبَ فِيهِ وَوُفِّيَتْ كُلُّ نَفْسٍ مَّا كَسَبَتْ وَهُمْ لَا يُظْلَمُونَ
rows.translation: Then how will it be when We shall gather them together on a day about which there is no doubt, and every soul shall be fully paid what it has earned, and they shall not be dealt with unjustly?
rows.transliteration: fakayfa idhā jama`nāhum liyawmin lā rayba fīhi wawuffiyat kullu nafsin mā kasabat wahum lā yuẓlamūn

rows.arabic: قُلِ ٱللَّهُمَّ مَـٰلِكَ ٱلْمُلْكِ تُؤْتِى ٱلْمُلْكَ مَن تَشَآءُ وَتَنزِعُ ٱلْمُلْكَ مِمَّن تَشَآءُ وَتُعِزُّ مَن تَشَآءُ وَتُذِلُّ مَن تَشَآءُ ۖ بِيَدِكَ ٱلْخَيْرُ ۖ إِنَّكَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَىْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
rows.translation: Say: O Allah, Master of the Kingdom! Thou givest the kingdom to whomsoever Thou pleasest and takest away the kingdom from whomsoever Thou pleasest, and Thou exaltest whom Thou pleasest and abasest whom Thou pleasest in Thine hand is the good; surety, Thou hast power over all things.
rows.transliteration: qulillāhumma mālikal mulki tu-til mulka man tashā-u watanzi`ul mulka mimman tashā-u watu`izzu man tashā-u watudhillu man tashā-u ۖ biyadikal khayr ۖ innaka `alā kulli shay-in qadīr

rows.arabic: تُولِجُ ٱلَّيْلَ فِى ٱلنَّهَارِ وَتُولِجُ ٱلنَّهَارَ فِى ٱلَّيْلِ ۖ وَتُخْرِجُ ٱلْحَىَّ مِنَ ٱلْمَيِّتِ وَتُخْرِجُ ٱلْمَيِّتَ مِنَ ٱلْحَىِّ ۖ وَتَرْزُقُ مَن تَشَآءُ بِغَيْرِ حِسَابٍ
rows.translation: Thou makest the night to pass into the day and Thou makest the day to pass into the night, and Thou bringest forth the living from the dead and Thou bringest forth the dead from the living, and Thou givest sustenance to whom Thou pleasest without measure.
rows.transliteration: tūlijul layla fin nahāri watūlijun nahāra fil layl ۖ watukhrijul ḥayya minal mayyiti watukhrijul mayyita minal ḥayy ۖ watarzuqu man tashā-u bighayri ḥisāb

rows.arabic: لَّا يَتَّخِذِ ٱلْمُؤْمِنُونَ ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ أَوْلِيَآءَ مِن دُونِ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ ۖ وَمَن يَفْعَلْ ذَٰلِكَ فَلَيْسَ مِنَ ٱللَّهِ فِى شَىْءٍ إِلَّآ أَن تَتَّقُوا۟ مِنْهُمْ تُقَىٰةً ۗ وَيُحَذِّرُكُمُ ٱللَّهُ نَفْسَهُۥ ۗ وَإِلَى ٱللَّهِ ٱلْمَصِيرُ
rows.translation: Let not the believers take the unbelievers for friends rather than believers; and whoever does this, he shall have nothing of (the guardianship of) Allah, but you should guard yourselves against them, guarding carefully; and Allah makes you cautious of (retribution from) Himself; and to Allah is the eventual coming.
rows.transliteration: lā yattakhidhil mu-minūnal kāfirīna awliyā-a min dūnil mu-minīn ۖ wa man yaf`al dhālika falaysa minallāhi fī shay-in illā an tattaqū minhum tuqah ۗ wayuḥadhhirukumullāhu nafsah ۗ wa ilallāhil maṣīr

rows.arabic: قُلْ إِن تُخْفُوا۟ مَا فِى صُدُورِكُمْ أَوْ تُبْدُوهُ يَعْلَمْهُ ٱللَّهُ ۗ وَيَعْلَمُ مَا فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَمَا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَىْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
rows.translation: Say: Whether you hide what is in your hearts or manifest it, Allah knows it, and He knows whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth, and Allah has power over all things.
rows.transliteration: qul in tukhfū mā fī ṣudūrikum aw tubdūhu ya`lamhullāh ۗ waya`lamu mā fis samāwāti wa mā fil-arḍ ۗ wallāhu `alā kulli shay-in qadīr

rows.arabic: يَوْمَ تَجِدُ كُلُّ نَفْسٍ مَّا عَمِلَتْ مِنْ خَيْرٍ مُّحْضَرًا وَمَا عَمِلَتْ مِن سُوٓءٍ تَوَدُّ لَوْ أَنَّ بَيْنَهَا وَبَيْنَهُۥٓ أَمَدًۢا بَعِيدًا ۗ وَيُحَذِّرُكُمُ ٱللَّهُ نَفْسَهُۥ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ رَءُوفٌۢ بِٱلْعِبَادِ
rows.translation: On the day that every soul shall find present what it has done of good and what it has done of evil, it shall wish that between it and that (evil) there were a long duration of time; and Allah makes you to be cautious of (retribution from) Himself; and Allah is Compassionate to the servants.
rows.transliteration: yawma tajidu kullu nafsin mā `amilat min khayrin muḥḍaran wa mā `amilat min sū-in tawaddu law anna baynahā wabaynahu amadan ba`īdā ۗ wayuḥadhhirukumullāhu nafsah ۗ wallāhu ra-ūfun bil `ibād

rows.arabic: قُلْ إِن كُنتُمْ تُحِبُّونَ ٱللَّهَ فَٱتَّبِعُونِى يُحْبِبْكُمُ ٱللَّهُ وَيَغْفِرْ لَكُمْ ذُنُوبَكُمْ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ غَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ
rows.translation: Say: If you love Allah, then follow me, Allah will love you and forgive you your faults, and Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.
rows.transliteration: qul in kuntum tuḥibbūnallāha fattabi`ūnī yuḥbibkumullāhu wayaghfir lakum dhunūbakum ۗ wallāhu ghafūrun raḥīm

rows.arabic: قُلْ أَطِيعُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَٱلرَّسُولَ ۖ فَإِن تَوَلَّوْا۟ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَا يُحِبُّ ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ
rows.translation: Say: Obey Allah and the Apostle; but if they turn back, then surely Allah does not love the unbelievers.
rows.transliteration: qul aṭī`ullāha war rasūl ۖ fa-in tawallaw fa-innallāha lā yuḥibbul kāfirīn

rows.arabic: إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ ٱصْطَفَىٰٓ ءَادَمَ وَنُوحًا وَءَالَ إِبْرَٰهِيمَ وَءَالَ عِمْرَٰنَ عَلَى ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
rows.translation: Surely Allah chose Adam and Nuh and the descendants of Ibrahim and the descendants of Imran above the nations.
rows.transliteration: innallāhaṣ-ṭafā ādama wanūḥan wa-āla ibrāhīma wa-āla `imrāna `alal-`ālamīn

rows.arabic: ذُرِّيَّةًۢ بَعْضُهَا مِنۢ بَعْضٍ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ سَمِيعٌ عَلِيمٌ
rows.translation: Offspring one of the other; and Allah is Hearing, Knowing.
rows.transliteration: dhurriyyatan ba`ḍuhā min ba`ḍ ۗ wallāhu samī`un `alīm

rows.arabic: إِذْ قَالَتِ ٱمْرَأَتُ عِمْرَٰنَ رَبِّ إِنِّى نَذَرْتُ لَكَ مَا فِى بَطْنِى مُحَرَّرًا فَتَقَبَّلْ مِنِّىٓ ۖ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ ٱلسَّمِيعُ ٱلْعَلِيمُ
rows.translation: When a woman of Imran said: My Lord! surely I vow to Thee what is in my womb, to be devoted (to Thy service); accept therefore from me, surely Thou art the Hearing, the Knowing.
rows.transliteration: idh qālatim-ra-atu `imrāna rabbi innī nadhartu laka mā fī baṭnī muḥarraran fataqabbal minnī ۖ innaka antas samī`ul `alīm

rows.arabic: فَلَمَّا وَضَعَتْهَا قَالَتْ رَبِّ إِنِّى وَضَعْتُهَآ أُنثَىٰ وَٱللَّهُ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا وَضَعَتْ وَلَيْسَ ٱلذَّكَرُ كَٱلْأُنثَىٰ ۖ وَإِنِّى سَمَّيْتُهَا مَرْيَمَ وَإِنِّىٓ أُعِيذُهَا بِكَ وَذُرِّيَّتَهَا مِنَ ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنِ ٱلرَّجِيمِ
rows.translation: So when she brought forth, she said: My Lord! Surely I have brought it forth a female-- and Allah knew best what she brought forth-- and the male is not like the female, and I have named it Marium, and I commend her and her offspring into Thy protection from the accursed Shaitan.
rows.transliteration: falammā waḍa`at-hā qālat rabbi innī waḍa`tuhā unthā wallāhu a`lamu bimā waḍa`at walaysadh dhakaru kal-unthā ۖ wa innī sammaytuhā maryama wa innī u`īdhuhā bika wadhurriyyatahā minash shayṭānir rajīm

rows.arabic: فَتَقَبَّلَهَا رَبُّهَا بِقَبُولٍ حَسَنٍ وَأَنۢبَتَهَا نَبَاتًا حَسَنًا وَكَفَّلَهَا زَكَرِيَّا ۖ كُلَّمَا دَخَلَ عَلَيْهَا زَكَرِيَّا ٱلْمِحْرَابَ وَجَدَ عِندَهَا رِزْقًا ۖ قَالَ يَـٰمَرْيَمُ أَنَّىٰ لَكِ هَـٰذَا ۖ قَالَتْ هُوَ مِنْ عِندِ ٱللَّهِ ۖ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَرْزُقُ مَن يَشَآءُ بِغَيْرِ حِسَابٍ
rows.translation: So her Lord accepted her with a good acceptance and made her grow up a good growing, and gave her into the charge of Zakariya; whenever Zakariya entered the sanctuary to (see) her, he found with her food. He said: O Marium! whence comes this to you? She said: It is from Allah. Surely Allah gives to whom He pleases without measure.
rows.transliteration: fataqabbalahā rabbuhā biqabūlin ḥasanin wa-anbatahā nabātan ḥasanan wakaffalahā zakariyyā ۖ kullamā dakhala `alayhā zakariyyal miḥrāba wajada `indahā rizqā ۖ qāla yāmaryamu annā laki hādhā ۖ qālat huwa min `indillāh ۖ innallāha yarzuqu man yashā-u bighayri ḥisāb

rows.arabic: هُنَالِكَ دَعَا زَكَرِيَّا رَبَّهُۥ ۖ قَالَ رَبِّ هَبْ لِى مِن لَّدُنكَ ذُرِّيَّةً طَيِّبَةً ۖ إِنَّكَ سَمِيعُ ٱلدُّعَآءِ
rows.translation: There did Zakariya pray to his Lord; he said: My Lord! grant me from Thee good offspring; surely Thou art the Hearer of prayer.
rows.transliteration: hunālika da`ā zakariyyā rabbah ۖ qāla rabbi hab lī min ladunka dhurriyyatan ṭayyibah ۖ innaka samī`ud du`ā-i

rows.arabic: فَنَادَتْهُ ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةُ وَهُوَ قَآئِمٌ يُصَلِّى فِى ٱلْمِحْرَابِ أَنَّ ٱللَّهَ يُبَشِّرُكَ بِيَحْيَىٰ مُصَدِّقًۢا بِكَلِمَةٍ مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ وَسَيِّدًا وَحَصُورًا وَنَبِيًّا مِّنَ ٱلصَّـٰلِحِينَ
rows.translation: Then the angels called to him as he stood praying in the sanctuary: That Allah gives you the good news of Yahya verifying a Word from Allah, and honorable and chaste and a prophet from among the good ones.
rows.transliteration: fanādat-hul malā-ikatu wahuwa qā-imun yuṣallī fil miḥrābi annallāha yubashhiruka biyaḥyā muṣaddiqan bikalimatim minallāhi wasayyidan waḥaṣūran wanabiyyan minaṣ ṣāliḥīn

rows.arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ أَنَّىٰ يَكُونُ لِى غُلَـٰمٌ وَقَدْ بَلَغَنِىَ ٱلْكِبَرُ وَٱمْرَأَتِى عَاقِرٌ ۖ قَالَ كَذَٰلِكَ ٱللَّهُ يَفْعَلُ مَا يَشَآءُ
rows.translation: He said: My Lord! when shall there be a son (born) to me, and old age has already come upon me, and my wife is barren? He said: even thus does Allah what He pleases.
rows.transliteration: qāla rabbi annā yakūnu lī ghulāmun waqad balaghaniyal kibaru wamra-atī `āqir ۖ qāla kadhālikallāhu yaf`alu mā yashā-u

rows.arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ ٱجْعَل لِّىٓ ءَايَةً ۖ قَالَ ءَايَتُكَ أَلَّا تُكَلِّمَ ٱلنَّاسَ ثَلَـٰثَةَ أَيَّامٍ إِلَّا رَمْزًا ۗ وَٱذْكُر رَّبَّكَ كَثِيرًا وَسَبِّحْ بِٱلْعَشِىِّ وَٱلْإِبْكَـٰرِ
rows.translation: He said: My Lord! appoint a sign for me. Said He: Your sign is that you should not speak to men for three days except by signs; and remember your Lord much and glorify Him in the evening and the morning.
rows.transliteration: qāla rabbij-`al lī āyah ۖ qāla āyatuka allā tukalliman nāsa thalāthata ayyāmin illā ramzā ۗ wadhkur rabbaka kathīran wasabbiḥ bil `ashiyyi wal-ibkār

rows.arabic: وَإِذْ قَالَتِ ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةُ يَـٰمَرْيَمُ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ ٱصْطَفَىٰكِ وَطَهَّرَكِ وَٱصْطَفَىٰكِ عَلَىٰ نِسَآءِ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
rows.translation: And when the angels said: O Marium! surely Allah has chosen you and purified you and chosen you above the women of the world.
rows.transliteration: wa idh qālatil malā-ikatu yāmaryamu innallāhaṣ-ṭafāki waṭahharaki waṣṭafāki `alā nisā-il `ālamīn

rows.arabic: يَـٰمَرْيَمُ ٱقْنُتِى لِرَبِّكِ وَٱسْجُدِى وَٱرْكَعِى مَعَ ٱلرَّٰكِعِينَ
rows.translation: O Marium! keep to obedience to your Lord and humble yourself, and bow down with those who bow.
rows.transliteration: yāmaryamuq-nutī lirabbiki wasjudī warka`ī ma`ar rāki`īn

rows.arabic: ذَٰلِكَ مِنْ أَنۢبَآءِ ٱلْغَيْبِ نُوحِيهِ إِلَيْكَ ۚ وَمَا كُنتَ لَدَيْهِمْ إِذْ يُلْقُونَ أَقْلَـٰمَهُمْ أَيُّهُمْ يَكْفُلُ مَرْيَمَ وَمَا كُنتَ لَدَيْهِمْ إِذْ يَخْتَصِمُونَ
rows.translation: This is of the announcements relating to the unseen which We reveal to you; and you were not with them when they cast their pens (to decide) which of them should have Marium in his charge, and you were not with them when they contended one with another.
rows.transliteration: dhālika min anbā-il ghaybi nūḥīhi ilayk ۚ wa mā kunta ladayhim idh yulqūna aqlāmahum ayyuhum yakfulu maryama wa mā kunta ladayhim idh yakhtaṣimūn

rows.arabic: إِذْ قَالَتِ ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةُ يَـٰمَرْيَمُ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يُبَشِّرُكِ بِكَلِمَةٍ مِّنْهُ ٱسْمُهُ ٱلْمَسِيحُ عِيسَى ٱبْنُ مَرْيَمَ وَجِيهًا فِى ٱلدُّنْيَا وَٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ وَمِنَ ٱلْمُقَرَّبِينَ
rows.translation: When the angels said: O Marium, surely Allah gives you good news with a Word from Him (of one) whose name is the '. Messiah, Isa son of Marium, worthy of regard in this world and the hereafter and of those who are made near (to Allah).
rows.transliteration: idh qālatil malā-ikatu yāmaryamu innallāha yubashhiruki bikalimatim minhus muhul masīḥu `īsab-nu maryama wajīhan fid dunyā wal-ākhirati wa minal muqarrabīn

rows.arabic: وَيُكَلِّمُ ٱلنَّاسَ فِى ٱلْمَهْدِ وَكَهْلًا وَمِنَ ٱلصَّـٰلِحِينَ
rows.translation: And he shall speak to the people when in the cradle and when of old age, and (he shall be) one of the good ones.
rows.transliteration: wayukallimun nāsa fil mahdi wakahlan wa minaṣ ṣāliḥīn

rows.arabic: قَالَتْ رَبِّ أَنَّىٰ يَكُونُ لِى وَلَدٌ وَلَمْ يَمْسَسْنِى بَشَرٌ ۖ قَالَ كَذَٰلِكِ ٱللَّهُ يَخْلُقُ مَا يَشَآءُ ۚ إِذَا قَضَىٰٓ أَمْرًا فَإِنَّمَا يَقُولُ لَهُۥ كُن فَيَكُونُ
rows.translation: She said: My Lord! when shall there be a son (born) to I me, and man has not touched me? He said: Even so, Allah creates what He pleases; when He has decreed a matter, He only says to it, Be, and it is.
rows.transliteration: qālat rabbi annā yakūnu lī waladun walam yamsasnī bashar ۖ qāla kadhālikillāhu yakhluqu mā yashā-u ۚ idhā qaḍā amran fa-innamā yaqūlu lahu kun fayakūn

rows.arabic: وَيُعَلِّمُهُ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ وَٱلْحِكْمَةَ وَٱلتَّوْرَىٰةَ وَٱلْإِنجِيلَ
rows.translation: And He will teach him the Book and the wisdom and the Tavrat and the Injeel.
rows.transliteration: wayu`allimuhul kitāba wal ḥikmata wat tawrāta wal-injīl

rows.arabic: وَرَسُولًا إِلَىٰ بَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ أَنِّى قَدْ جِئْتُكُم بِـَٔايَةٍ مِّن رَّبِّكُمْ ۖ أَنِّىٓ أَخْلُقُ لَكُم مِّنَ ٱلطِّينِ كَهَيْـَٔةِ ٱلطَّيْرِ فَأَنفُخُ فِيهِ فَيَكُونُ طَيْرًۢا بِإِذْنِ ٱللَّهِ ۖ وَأُبْرِئُ ٱلْأَكْمَهَ وَٱلْأَبْرَصَ وَأُحْىِ ٱلْمَوْتَىٰ بِإِذْنِ ٱللَّهِ ۖ وَأُنَبِّئُكُم بِمَا تَأْكُلُونَ وَمَا تَدَّخِرُونَ فِى بُيُوتِكُمْ ۚ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةً لَّكُمْ إِن كُنتُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
rows.translation: And (make him) an apostle to the children of Israel: That I have come to you with a sign from your Lord, that I determine for you out of dust like the form of a bird, then I breathe into it and it becomes a bird with Allah's permission and I heal the blind and the leprous, and bring the dead to life with Allah's permission and I inform you of what you should eat and what you should store in your houses; most surely there is a sign in this for you, if you are believers.
rows.transliteration: warasūlan ilā banī isrā-iyla annī qad ji-tukum bi-āyatim min rabbikum ۖ annī akhluqu lakum minaṭ ṭīni kahay-atiṭ ṭayri fa-anfukhu fīhi fayakūnu ṭayran bi-idhnillāh ۖ wa-ubri-ul-akmaha wal-abraṣa wa-uḥyil mawtā bi-idhnillāh ۖ wa-unabbi-ukum bimā ta-kulūna wa mā taddakhirūna fī buyūtikum ۚ inna fī dhālika la-āyatan lakum in kuntum mu-minīn

rows.arabic: وَمُصَدِّقًا لِّمَا بَيْنَ يَدَىَّ مِنَ ٱلتَّوْرَىٰةِ وَلِأُحِلَّ لَكُم بَعْضَ ٱلَّذِى حُرِّمَ عَلَيْكُمْ ۚ وَجِئْتُكُم بِـَٔايَةٍ مِّن رَّبِّكُمْ فَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ
rows.translation: And a verifier of that which is before me of the Taurat and that I may allow you part of that which has been forbidden t you, and I have come to you with a sign from your Lord therefore be careful of (your duty to) Allah and obey me.
rows.transliteration: wa muṣaddiqal limā bayna yadayya minat tawrāti wali-uḥilla lakum ba`ḍal ladhī ḥurrima `alaykum ۚ waji-tukum bi-āyatim min rabbikum fattaqullāha wa-aṭī`ūn

rows.arabic: إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ رَبِّى وَرَبُّكُمْ فَٱعْبُدُوهُ ۗ هَـٰذَا صِرَٰطٌ مُّسْتَقِيمٌ
rows.translation: Surely Allah is my Lord and your Lord, therefore serve Him; this is the right path.
rows.transliteration: innallāha rabbī warabbukum fa`budūh ۗ hādhā ṣirāṭun mustaqīm

rows.arabic: فَلَمَّآ أَحَسَّ عِيسَىٰ مِنْهُمُ ٱلْكُفْرَ قَالَ مَنْ أَنصَارِىٓ إِلَى ٱللَّهِ ۖ قَالَ ٱلْحَوَارِيُّونَ نَحْنُ أَنصَارُ ٱللَّهِ ءَامَنَّا بِٱللَّهِ وَٱشْهَدْ بِأَنَّا مُسْلِمُونَ
rows.translation: But when Isa perceived unbelief on their part, he said Who will be my helpers in Allah's way? The disciples said: We are helpers (in the way) of Allah: We believe in Allah and bear witness that we are submitting ones.
rows.transliteration: falammā aḥassa `īsā minhumul kufra qāla man anṣārī ilallāh ۖ qālal-ḥawāriyyūna naḥnu anṣārullāhi āmannā billāhi wash-had bi-annā muslimūn

rows.arabic: رَبَّنَآ ءَامَنَّا بِمَآ أَنزَلْتَ وَٱتَّبَعْنَا ٱلرَّسُولَ فَٱكْتُبْنَا مَعَ ٱلشَّـٰهِدِينَ
rows.translation: Our Lord! we believe in what Thou hast revealed and we follow the apostle, so write us down with those who bear witness.
rows.transliteration: rabbanā āmannā bimā anzalta wattaba`nar rasūla faktubnā ma`ash shāhidīn

rows.arabic: وَمَكَرُوا۟ وَمَكَرَ ٱللَّهُ ۖ وَٱللَّهُ خَيْرُ ٱلْمَـٰكِرِينَ
rows.translation: And they planned and Allah (also) planned, and Allah is the best of planners.
rows.transliteration: wa makarū wa makarallāh ۖ wallāhu khayrul mākirīn

rows.arabic: إِذْ قَالَ ٱللَّهُ يَـٰعِيسَىٰٓ إِنِّى مُتَوَفِّيكَ وَرَافِعُكَ إِلَىَّ وَمُطَهِّرُكَ مِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ وَجَاعِلُ ٱلَّذِينَ ٱتَّبَعُوكَ فَوْقَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوٓا۟ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ ۖ ثُمَّ إِلَىَّ مَرْجِعُكُمْ فَأَحْكُمُ بَيْنَكُمْ فِيمَا كُنتُمْ فِيهِ تَخْتَلِفُونَ
rows.translation: And when Allah said: O Isa, I am going to terminate the period of your stay (on earth) and cause you to ascend unto Me and purify you of those who disbelieve and make those who follow you above those who disbelieve to the day of resurrection; then to Me shall be your return, so l will decide between you concerning that in which you differed.
rows.transliteration: idh qālallāhu yā`īsā innī mutawaffīka warāfi`uka ilayya wa muṭahhiruka minal ladhīna kafarū wajā`ilul ladhīnat-taba`ūka fawqal ladhīna kafarū ilā yawmil qiyāmah ۖ thumma ilayya marji`ukum fa-aḥkumu baynakum fīmā kuntum fīhi takhtalifūn

rows.arabic: فَأَمَّا ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ فَأُعَذِّبُهُمْ عَذَابًا شَدِيدًا فِى ٱلدُّنْيَا وَٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ وَمَا لَهُم مِّن نَّـٰصِرِينَ
rows.translation: Then as to those who disbelieve, I will chastise them with severe chastisement in this world and the hereafter, and they shall have no helpers.
rows.transliteration: fa-ammal ladhīna kafarū fa-u`adhhibuhum `adhāban shadīdan fid dunyā wal-ākhirati wa mā lahum min nāṣirīn

rows.arabic: وَأَمَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ فَيُوَفِّيهِمْ أُجُورَهُمْ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ لَا يُحِبُّ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
rows.translation: And as to those who believe and do good deeds, He will pay them fully their rewards; and Allah does not love the unjust.
rows.transliteration: wa-ammal ladhīna āmanū wa`amiluṣ ṣāliḥāti fayuwaffīhim ujūrahum ۗ wallāhu lā yuḥibbuẓ ẓālimīn

rows.arabic: ذَٰلِكَ نَتْلُوهُ عَلَيْكَ مِنَ ٱلْـَٔايَـٰتِ وَٱلذِّكْرِ ٱلْحَكِيمِ
rows.translation: This We recite to you of the communications and the wise reminder.
rows.transliteration: dhālika natlūhu `alayka minal-āyāti wadh dhikril ḥakīm

rows.arabic: إِنَّ مَثَلَ عِيسَىٰ عِندَ ٱللَّهِ كَمَثَلِ ءَادَمَ ۖ خَلَقَهُۥ مِن تُرَابٍ ثُمَّ قَالَ لَهُۥ كُن فَيَكُونُ
rows.translation: Surely the likeness of Isa is with Allah as the likeness of Adam; He created him from dust, then said to him, Be, and he was.
rows.transliteration: inna mathala `īsā `indallāhi kamathali ādam ۖ khalaqahu min turābin thumma qāla lahu kun fayakūn

rows.arabic: ٱلْحَقُّ مِن رَّبِّكَ فَلَا تَكُن مِّنَ ٱلْمُمْتَرِينَ
rows.translation: (This is) the truth from your Lord, so be not of the disputers.
rows.transliteration: al-ḥaqqu min rabbika falā takun minal mumtarīn

rows.arabic: فَمَنْ حَآجَّكَ فِيهِ مِنۢ بَعْدِ مَا جَآءَكَ مِنَ ٱلْعِلْمِ فَقُلْ تَعَالَوْا۟ نَدْعُ أَبْنَآءَنَا وَأَبْنَآءَكُمْ وَنِسَآءَنَا وَنِسَآءَكُمْ وَأَنفُسَنَا وَأَنفُسَكُمْ ثُمَّ نَبْتَهِلْ فَنَجْعَل لَّعْنَتَ ٱللَّهِ عَلَى ٱلْكَـٰذِبِينَ
rows.translation: But whoever disputes with you in this matter after what has come to you of knowledge, then say: Come let us call our sons and your sons and our women and your women and our near people and your near people, then let us be earnest in prayer, and pray for the curse of Allah on the liars.
rows.transliteration: faman ḥājjaka fīhi min ba`di mā jā-aka minal `il-mi faqul ta`ālaw nad`u abnā-anā wa-abnā-akum wanisā-anā wanisā-akum wa-anfusanā wa-anfusakum thumma nabtahil fanaj`al la`natallāhi `alal-kādhibīn

rows.arabic: إِنَّ هَـٰذَا لَهُوَ ٱلْقَصَصُ ٱلْحَقُّ ۚ وَمَا مِنْ إِلَـٰهٍ إِلَّا ٱللَّهُ ۚ وَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْحَكِيمُ
rows.translation: Most surely this is the true explanation, and there is no god but Allah; and most surely Allah-- He is the Mighty, the Wise.
rows.transliteration: inna hādhā lahuwal qaṣaṣul ḥaqq ۚ wa mā min ilāhin illallāh ۚ wa innallāha lahuwal `azīzul ḥakīm

rows.arabic: فَإِن تَوَلَّوْا۟ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ عَلِيمٌۢ بِٱلْمُفْسِدِينَ
rows.translation: But if they turn back, then surely Allah knows the mischief-makers.
rows.transliteration: fa-in tawallaw fa-innallāha `alīmun bil mufsidīn

rows.arabic: قُلْ يَـٰٓأَهْلَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ تَعَالَوْا۟ إِلَىٰ كَلِمَةٍ سَوَآءٍۭ بَيْنَنَا وَبَيْنَكُمْ أَلَّا نَعْبُدَ إِلَّا ٱللَّهَ وَلَا نُشْرِكَ بِهِۦ شَيْـًٔا وَلَا يَتَّخِذَ بَعْضُنَا بَعْضًا أَرْبَابًا مِّن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ ۚ فَإِن تَوَلَّوْا۟ فَقُولُوا۟ ٱشْهَدُوا۟ بِأَنَّا مُسْلِمُونَ
rows.translation: Say: O followers of the Book! come to an equitable proposition between us and you that we shall not serve any but Allah and (that) we shall not associate aught with Him, and (that) some of us shall not take others for lords besides Allah; but if they turn back, then say: Bear witness that we are Muslims.
rows.transliteration: qul yā-ahlal-kitābi ta`ālaw ilā kalimatin sawā-in baynanā wabaynakum allā na`buda illallāha walā nushrika bihi shay-an walā yattakhidha ba`ḍunā ba`ḍan arbāban min dūnillāh ۚ fa-in tawallaw faqūlush-hadū bi-annā muslimūn

rows.arabic: يَـٰٓأَهْلَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ لِمَ تُحَآجُّونَ فِىٓ إِبْرَٰهِيمَ وَمَآ أُنزِلَتِ ٱلتَّوْرَىٰةُ وَٱلْإِنجِيلُ إِلَّا مِنۢ بَعْدِهِۦٓ ۚ أَفَلَا تَعْقِلُونَ
rows.translation: O followers of the Book! why do you dispute about Ibrahim, when the Taurat and the Injeel were not revealed till after him; do you not then understand?
rows.transliteration: yā-ahlal-kitābi lima tuḥājjūna fī ibrāhīma wa mā unzilatit tawrātu wal-injīlu illā min ba`dih ۚ afalā ta`qilūn

rows.arabic: هَـٰٓأَنتُمْ هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ حَـٰجَجْتُمْ فِيمَا لَكُم بِهِۦ عِلْمٌ فَلِمَ تُحَآجُّونَ فِيمَا لَيْسَ لَكُم بِهِۦ عِلْمٌ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ يَعْلَمُ وَأَنتُمْ لَا تَعْلَمُونَ
rows.translation: Behold! you are they who disputed about that of which you had knowledge; why then do you dispute about that of which you have no knowledge? And Allah knows while you do not know.
rows.transliteration: hā-antum hā-ulā-i ḥājajtum fīmā lakum bihi `il-mun falima tuḥājjūna fīmā laysa lakum bihi `il-m ۚ wallāhu ya`lamu wa-antum lā ta`lamūn

rows.arabic: مَا كَانَ إِبْرَٰهِيمُ يَهُودِيًّا وَلَا نَصْرَانِيًّا وَلَـٰكِن كَانَ حَنِيفًا مُّسْلِمًا وَمَا كَانَ مِنَ ٱلْمُشْرِكِينَ
rows.translation: Ibrahim was not a Jew nor a Christian but he was (an) upright (man), a Muslim, and he was not one of the polytheists.
rows.transliteration: mā kāna ibrāhīmu yahūdiyyan walā naṣrāniyyan walākin kāna ḥanīfan musliman wa mā kāna minal mushrikīn

rows.arabic: إِنَّ أَوْلَى ٱلنَّاسِ بِإِبْرَٰهِيمَ لَلَّذِينَ ٱتَّبَعُوهُ وَهَـٰذَا ٱلنَّبِىُّ وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ وَلِىُّ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
rows.translation: Most surely the nearest of people to Ibrahim are those who followed him and this Prophet and those who believe and Allah is the guardian of the believers.
rows.transliteration: inna awlan nāsi bi-ibrāhīma lalladhīnat-taba`ūhu wahādhan nabiyyu wal ladhīna āmanū ۗ wallāhu waliyyul mu-minīn

rows.arabic: وَدَّت طَّآئِفَةٌ مِّنْ أَهْلِ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ لَوْ يُضِلُّونَكُمْ وَمَا يُضِلُّونَ إِلَّآ أَنفُسَهُمْ وَمَا يَشْعُرُونَ
rows.translation: A party of the followers of the Book desire that they should lead you astray, and they lead not astray but themselves, and they do not perceive.
rows.transliteration: waddat ṭā-ifatun min ahlil kitābi law yuḍillūnakum wa mā yuḍillūna illā anfusahum wa mā yash`urūn

rows.arabic: يَـٰٓأَهْلَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ لِمَ تَكْفُرُونَ بِـَٔايَـٰتِ ٱللَّهِ وَأَنتُمْ تَشْهَدُونَ
rows.translation: O followers of the Book! Why do you disbelieve in the communications of Allah while you witness (them)?
rows.transliteration: yā-ahlal-kitābi lima takfurūna bi-āyātillāhi wa-antum tash-hadūn

rows.arabic: يَـٰٓأَهْلَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ لِمَ تَلْبِسُونَ ٱلْحَقَّ بِٱلْبَـٰطِلِ وَتَكْتُمُونَ ٱلْحَقَّ وَأَنتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ
rows.translation: O followers of the Book! Why do you confound the truth with the falsehood and hide the truth while you know?
rows.transliteration: yā-ahlal-kitābi lima talbisūnal ḥaqqa bil bāṭili wataktumūnal ḥaqqa wa-antum ta`lamūn

rows.arabic: وَقَالَت طَّآئِفَةٌ مِّنْ أَهْلِ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ ءَامِنُوا۟ بِٱلَّذِىٓ أُنزِلَ عَلَى ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَجْهَ ٱلنَّهَارِ وَٱكْفُرُوٓا۟ ءَاخِرَهُۥ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَرْجِعُونَ
rows.translation: And a party of the followers of the Book say: Avow belief in that which has been revealed to those who believe, in the first part of the day, and disbelieve at the end of it, perhaps they go back on their religion.
rows.transliteration: waqālat ṭā-ifatun min ahlil kitābi āminū bil ladhī unzila `alal ladhīna āmanū wajhan nahāri wakfurū ākhirahu la`allahum yarji`ūn

rows.arabic: وَلَا تُؤْمِنُوٓا۟ إِلَّا لِمَن تَبِعَ دِينَكُمْ قُلْ إِنَّ ٱلْهُدَىٰ هُدَى ٱللَّهِ أَن يُؤْتَىٰٓ أَحَدٌ مِّثْلَ مَآ أُوتِيتُمْ أَوْ يُحَآجُّوكُمْ عِندَ رَبِّكُمْ ۗ قُلْ إِنَّ ٱلْفَضْلَ بِيَدِ ٱللَّهِ يُؤْتِيهِ مَن يَشَآءُ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ وَٰسِعٌ عَلِيمٌ
rows.translation: And do not believe but in him who follows your religion. Say: Surely the (true) guidance is the guidance of Allah-- that one may be given (by Him) the like of what you were given; or they would contend with you by an argument before your Lord. Say: Surely grace is in the hand of Allah, He gives it to whom He pleases; and Allah is Ample-giving, Knowing.
rows.transliteration: walā tu-minū illā liman tabi`a dīnakum qul innal hudā hudallāhi an yu-tā aḥadun mithla mā ūtītum aw yuḥājjūkum `inda rabbikum ۗ qul innal faḍla biyadillāhi yu-tīhi man yashā-u ۗ wallāhu wāsi`un `alīm

rows.arabic: يَخْتَصُّ بِرَحْمَتِهِۦ مَن يَشَآءُ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ ذُو ٱلْفَضْلِ ٱلْعَظِيمِ
rows.translation: He specially chooses for His mercy whom He pleases; and Allah is the Lord of mighty grace.
rows.transliteration: yakhtaṣṣu biraḥmatihi man yashā-u ۗ wallāhu dhul faḍlil `aẓīm

rows.arabic: وَمِنْ أَهْلِ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ مَنْ إِن تَأْمَنْهُ بِقِنطَارٍ يُؤَدِّهِۦٓ إِلَيْكَ وَمِنْهُم مَّنْ إِن تَأْمَنْهُ بِدِينَارٍ لَّا يُؤَدِّهِۦٓ إِلَيْكَ إِلَّا مَا دُمْتَ عَلَيْهِ قَآئِمًا ۗ ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُمْ قَالُوا۟ لَيْسَ عَلَيْنَا فِى ٱلْأُمِّيِّـۧنَ سَبِيلٌ وَيَقُولُونَ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ ٱلْكَذِبَ وَهُمْ يَعْلَمُونَ
rows.translation: And among the followers of the Book there are some such that if you entrust one (of them) with a heap of wealth, he shall pay it back to you; and among them there are some such that if you entrust one (of them) with a dinar he shall not pay it back to you except so long as you remain firm in demanding it; this is because they say: There is not upon us in the matter of the unlearned people any way (to reproach); and they tell a lie against Allah while they know.
rows.transliteration: wa min ahlil kitābi man in ta-manhu biqinṭāriy yu-addihi ilayka wa minhum man in ta-manhu bidīnārin lā yu-addihi ilayka illā mā dumta `alayhi qā-imā ۗ dhālika bi-annahum qālū laysa `alaynā fil-ummiyyīna sabīlun wayaqūlūna `alallāhil kadhiba wahum ya`lamūn

rows.arabic: بَلَىٰ مَنْ أَوْفَىٰ بِعَهْدِهِۦ وَٱتَّقَىٰ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يُحِبُّ ٱلْمُتَّقِينَ
rows.translation: Yea, whoever fulfills his promise and guards (against evil)-- then surely Allah loves those who guard (against evil).
rows.transliteration: balā man awfā bi`ahdihi wattaqā fa-innallāha yuḥibbul muttaqīn

rows.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ يَشْتَرُونَ بِعَهْدِ ٱللَّهِ وَأَيْمَـٰنِهِمْ ثَمَنًا قَلِيلًا أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ لَا خَلَـٰقَ لَهُمْ فِى ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ وَلَا يُكَلِّمُهُمُ ٱللَّهُ وَلَا يَنظُرُ إِلَيْهِمْ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ وَلَا يُزَكِّيهِمْ وَلَهُمْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ
rows.translation: (As for) those who take a small price for the covenant of Allah and their own oaths-- surely they shall have no portion in the hereafter, and Allah will not speak to them, nor will He look upon them on the day of resurrection nor will He purify them, and they shall have a painful chastisement.
rows.transliteration: innal ladhīna yashtarūna bi`ahdillāhi wa-aymānihim thamanan qalīlan ulā-ika lā khalāqa lahum fil-ākhirati walā yukallimuhumullāhu walā yanẓuru ilayhim yawmal qiyāmati walā yuzakkīhim walahum `adhābun alīm

rows.arabic: وَإِنَّ مِنْهُمْ لَفَرِيقًا يَلْوُۥنَ أَلْسِنَتَهُم بِٱلْكِتَـٰبِ لِتَحْسَبُوهُ مِنَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ وَمَا هُوَ مِنَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ وَيَقُولُونَ هُوَ مِنْ عِندِ ٱللَّهِ وَمَا هُوَ مِنْ عِندِ ٱللَّهِ وَيَقُولُونَ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ ٱلْكَذِبَ وَهُمْ يَعْلَمُونَ
rows.translation: Most surely there is a party amongst those who distort the Book with their tongue that you may consider it to be (a part) of the Book, and they say, It is from Allah, while it is not from Allah, and they tell a lie against Allah whilst they know.
rows.transliteration: wa inna minhum lafarīqan yalwūna alsinatahum bil kitābi litaḥsabūhu minal kitābi wa mā huwa minal kitābi wayaqūlūna huwa min `indillāhi wa mā huwa min `indillāhi wayaqūlūna `alallāhil kadhiba wahum ya`lamūn

rows.arabic: مَا كَانَ لِبَشَرٍ أَن يُؤْتِيَهُ ٱللَّهُ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ وَٱلْحُكْمَ وَٱلنُّبُوَّةَ ثُمَّ يَقُولَ لِلنَّاسِ كُونُوا۟ عِبَادًا لِّى مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ وَلَـٰكِن كُونُوا۟ رَبَّـٰنِيِّـۧنَ بِمَا كُنتُمْ تُعَلِّمُونَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ وَبِمَا كُنتُمْ تَدْرُسُونَ
rows.translation: It is not meet for a mortal that Allah should give him the Book and the wisdom and prophethood, then he should say to men: Be my servants rather than Allah's; but rather (he would say): Be worshippers of the Lord because of your teaching the Book and your reading (it yourselves).
rows.transliteration: mā kāna libasharin an yu-tiyahullāhul kitāba wal ḥukma wan nubuwwata thumma yaqūla linnāsi kūnū `ibādal lī min dūnillāhi walākin kūnū rabbāniyyīna bimā kuntum tu`allimūnal kitāba wabimā kuntum tadrusūn

rows.arabic: وَلَا يَأْمُرَكُمْ أَن تَتَّخِذُوا۟ ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةَ وَٱلنَّبِيِّـۧنَ أَرْبَابًا ۗ أَيَأْمُرُكُم بِٱلْكُفْرِ بَعْدَ إِذْ أَنتُم مُّسْلِمُونَ
rows.translation: And neither would he enjoin you that you should take the angels and the prophets for lords; what! would he enjoin you with unbelief after you are Muslims?
rows.transliteration: walā ya-murakum an tattakhidhul malā-ikata wan nabiyyīna arbābā ۗ aya-murukum bil kufri ba`da idh antum muslimūn

rows.arabic: وَإِذْ أَخَذَ ٱللَّهُ مِيثَـٰقَ ٱلنَّبِيِّـۧنَ لَمَآ ءَاتَيْتُكُم مِّن كِتَـٰبٍ وَحِكْمَةٍ ثُمَّ جَآءَكُمْ رَسُولٌ مُّصَدِّقٌ لِّمَا مَعَكُمْ لَتُؤْمِنُنَّ بِهِۦ وَلَتَنصُرُنَّهُۥ ۚ قَالَ ءَأَقْرَرْتُمْ وَأَخَذْتُمْ عَلَىٰ ذَٰلِكُمْ إِصْرِى ۖ قَالُوٓا۟ أَقْرَرْنَا ۚ قَالَ فَٱشْهَدُوا۟ وَأَنَا۠ مَعَكُم مِّنَ ٱلشَّـٰهِدِينَ
rows.translation: And when Allah made a covenant through the prophets: Certainly what I have given you of Book and wisdom-- then an apostle comes to you verifying that which is with you, you must believe in him, and you must aid him. He said: Do you affirm and accept My compact in this (matter)? They said: We do affirm. He said: Then bear witness, and I (too) am of the bearers of witness with you.
rows.transliteration: wa idh akhadhallāhu mīthāqan nabiyyīna lamā ātaytukum min kitābin waḥikmatin thumma jā-akum rasūlun muṣaddiqul limā ma`akum latu-minunna bihi walatanṣurunnah ۚ qāla a-aqrartum wa-akhadhtum `alā dhālikum iṣrī ۖ qālū aqrarnā ۚ qāla fash-hadū wa-ana ma`akum minash shāhidīn

rows.arabic: فَمَن تَوَلَّىٰ بَعْدَ ذَٰلِكَ فَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلْفَـٰسِقُونَ
rows.translation: Whoever therefore turns back after this, these it is that are the transgressors.
rows.transliteration: faman tawallā ba`da dhālika fa-ulā-ika humul fāsiqūn

rows.arabic: أَفَغَيْرَ دِينِ ٱللَّهِ يَبْغُونَ وَلَهُۥٓ أَسْلَمَ مَن فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ طَوْعًا وَكَرْهًا وَإِلَيْهِ يُرْجَعُونَ
rows.translation: Is it then other than Allah's religion that they seek (to follow), and to Him submits whoever is in the heavens and the earth, willingly or unwillingly, and to Him shall they be returned.
rows.transliteration: afaghayra dīnillāhi yabghūna walahu aslama man fis samāwāti wal-arḍi ṭaw`an wakarhan wa ilayhi yurja`ūn

rows.arabic: قُلْ ءَامَنَّا بِٱللَّهِ وَمَآ أُنزِلَ عَلَيْنَا وَمَآ أُنزِلَ عَلَىٰٓ إِبْرَٰهِيمَ وَإِسْمَـٰعِيلَ وَإِسْحَـٰقَ وَيَعْقُوبَ وَٱلْأَسْبَاطِ وَمَآ أُوتِىَ مُوسَىٰ وَعِيسَىٰ وَٱلنَّبِيُّونَ مِن رَّبِّهِمْ لَا نُفَرِّقُ بَيْنَ أَحَدٍ مِّنْهُمْ وَنَحْنُ لَهُۥ مُسْلِمُونَ
rows.translation: Say: We believe in Allah and what has been revealed to us, and what was revealed to Ibrahim and Ismail and Ishaq and Yaqoub and the tribes, and what was given to Musa and Isa and to the prophets from their Lord; we do not make any distinction between any of them, and to Him do we submit.
rows.transliteration: qul āmannā billāhi wa mā unzila `alaynā wa mā unzila `alā ibrāhīma wa ismā`īla wa is-ḥāqa waya`qūba wal-asbāṭi wa mā ūtiya mūsā wa`īsā wan nabiyyūna min rabbihim lā nufarriqu bayna aḥadin minhum wanaḥnu lahu muslimūn

rows.arabic: وَمَن يَبْتَغِ غَيْرَ ٱلْإِسْلَـٰمِ دِينًا فَلَن يُقْبَلَ مِنْهُ وَهُوَ فِى ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ مِنَ ٱلْخَـٰسِرِينَ
rows.translation: And whoever desires a religion other than Islam, it shall not be accepted from him, and in the hereafter he shall be one of the losers.
rows.transliteration: wa man yabtaghi ghayral-islāmi dīnan falan yuqbala minhu wahuwa fil-ākhirati minal khāsirīn

rows.arabic: كَيْفَ يَهْدِى ٱللَّهُ قَوْمًا كَفَرُوا۟ بَعْدَ إِيمَـٰنِهِمْ وَشَهِدُوٓا۟ أَنَّ ٱلرَّسُولَ حَقٌّ وَجَآءَهُمُ ٱلْبَيِّنَـٰتُ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ لَا يَهْدِى ٱلْقَوْمَ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
rows.translation: How shall Allah guide a people who disbelieved after their believing and (after) they had borne witness that the Apostle was true and clear arguments had come to them; and Allah does not guide the unjust people.
rows.transliteration: kayfa yahdillāhu qawman kafarū ba`da-iymānihim washahidū annar rasūla ḥaqqun wajā-ahumul bayyināt ۚ wallāhu lā yahdil qawmaẓ ẓālimīn

rows.arabic: أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ جَزَآؤُهُمْ أَنَّ عَلَيْهِمْ لَعْنَةَ ٱللَّهِ وَٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةِ وَٱلنَّاسِ أَجْمَعِينَ
rows.translation: (As for) these, their reward is that upon them is the curse of Allah and the angels and of men, all together.
rows.transliteration: ulā-ika jazā-uhum anna `alayhim la`natallāhi wal malā-ikati wan nāsi ajma`īn

rows.arabic: خَـٰلِدِينَ فِيهَا لَا يُخَفَّفُ عَنْهُمُ ٱلْعَذَابُ وَلَا هُمْ يُنظَرُونَ
rows.translation: Abiding in it; their chastisement shall not be lightened nor shall they be respited.
rows.transliteration: khālidīna fīhā lā yukhaffafu `anhumul `adhābu walā hum yunẓarūn

rows.arabic: إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ تَابُوا۟ مِنۢ بَعْدِ ذَٰلِكَ وَأَصْلَحُوا۟ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ غَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ
rows.translation: Except those who repent after that and amend, then surely Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.
rows.transliteration: illal ladhīna tābū min ba`di dhālika wa-aṣlaḥū fa-innallāha ghafūrun raḥīm

rows.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ بَعْدَ إِيمَـٰنِهِمْ ثُمَّ ٱزْدَادُوا۟ كُفْرًا لَّن تُقْبَلَ تَوْبَتُهُمْ وَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلضَّآلُّونَ
rows.translation: Surely, those who disbelieve after their believing, then increase in unbelief, their repentance shall not be accepted, and these are they that go astray.
rows.transliteration: innal ladhīna kafarū ba`da-iymānihim thummaz-dādū kufral lan tuqbala tawbatuhum wa-ulā-ika humuḍ ḍāllūn

rows.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ وَمَاتُوا۟ وَهُمْ كُفَّارٌ فَلَن يُقْبَلَ مِنْ أَحَدِهِم مِّلْءُ ٱلْأَرْضِ ذَهَبًا وَلَوِ ٱفْتَدَىٰ بِهِۦٓ ۗ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ لَهُمْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ وَمَا لَهُم مِّن نَّـٰصِرِينَ
rows.translation: Surely, those who disbelieve and die while they are unbelievers, the earth full of gold shall not be accepted from one of them, though he should offer to ransom himself with it, these it is who shall have a painful chastisement, and they shall have no helpers.
rows.transliteration: innal ladhīna kafarū wa mātū wahum kuffārun falan yuqbala min aḥadihim mil-ul-arḍi dhahaban walawif-tadā bih ۗ ulā-ika lahum `adhābun alīmun wa mā lahum min nāṣirīn

rows.arabic: لَن تَنَالُوا۟ ٱلْبِرَّ حَتَّىٰ تُنفِقُوا۟ مِمَّا تُحِبُّونَ ۚ وَمَا تُنفِقُوا۟ مِن شَىْءٍ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ بِهِۦ عَلِيمٌ
rows.translation: By no means shall you attain to righteousness until you spend (benevolently) out of what you love; and whatever thing you spend, Allah surely knows it.
rows.transliteration: lan tanālul birra ḥattā tunfiqū mimmā tuḥibbūn ۚ wa mā tunfiqū min shay-in fa-innallāha bihi `alīm

rows.arabic: كُلُّ ٱلطَّعَامِ كَانَ حِلًّا لِّبَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ إِلَّا مَا حَرَّمَ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلُ عَلَىٰ نَفْسِهِۦ مِن قَبْلِ أَن تُنَزَّلَ ٱلتَّوْرَىٰةُ ۗ قُلْ فَأْتُوا۟ بِٱلتَّوْرَىٰةِ فَٱتْلُوهَآ إِن كُنتُمْ صَـٰدِقِينَ
rows.translation: All food was lawful to the children of Israel except that which Israel had forbidden to himself, before the Taurat was revealed. Say: Bring then the Taurat and read it, if you are truthful.
rows.transliteration: kulluṭ ṭa`āmi kāna ḥillal libanī isrā-iyla illā mā ḥarrama isrā-iylu `alā nafsihi min qabli an tunazzalat tawrāh ۗ qul fa-tū bit tawrāti fatlūhā in kuntum ṣādiqīn

rows.arabic: فَمَنِ ٱفْتَرَىٰ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ ٱلْكَذِبَ مِنۢ بَعْدِ ذَٰلِكَ فَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلظَّـٰلِمُونَ
rows.translation: Then whoever fabricates a lie against Allah after this, these it is that are the unjust.
rows.transliteration: famanif-tarā `alallāhil kadhiba min ba`di dhālika fa-ulā-ika humuẓ ẓālimūn

rows.arabic: قُلْ صَدَقَ ٱللَّهُ ۗ فَٱتَّبِعُوا۟ مِلَّةَ إِبْرَٰهِيمَ حَنِيفًا وَمَا كَانَ مِنَ ٱلْمُشْرِكِينَ
rows.translation: Say: Allah has spoken the truth, therefore follow the religion of Ibrahim, the upright one; and he was not one of the polytheists.
rows.transliteration: qul ṣadaqallāh ۗ fattabi`ū millata ibrāhīma ḥanīfan wa mā kāna minal mushrikīn

rows.arabic: إِنَّ أَوَّلَ بَيْتٍ وُضِعَ لِلنَّاسِ لَلَّذِى بِبَكَّةَ مُبَارَكًا وَهُدًى لِّلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
rows.translation: Most surely the first house appointed for men is the one at Bekka, blessed and a guidance for the nations.
rows.transliteration: inna awwala baytin wuḍi`a linnāsi lalladhī bibakkata mubārakan wahudan lil`ālamīn

rows.arabic: فِيهِ ءَايَـٰتٌۢ بَيِّنَـٰتٌ مَّقَامُ إِبْرَٰهِيمَ ۖ وَمَن دَخَلَهُۥ كَانَ ءَامِنًا ۗ وَلِلَّهِ عَلَى ٱلنَّاسِ حِجُّ ٱلْبَيْتِ مَنِ ٱسْتَطَاعَ إِلَيْهِ سَبِيلًا ۚ وَمَن كَفَرَ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ غَنِىٌّ عَنِ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
rows.translation: In it are clear signs, the standing place of Ibrahim, and whoever enters it shall be secure, and pilgrimage to the House is incumbent upon men for the sake of Allah, (upon) every one who is able to undertake the journey to it; and whoever disbelieves, then surely Allah is Self-sufficient, above any need of the worlds.
rows.transliteration: fīhi āyātun bayyinātun maqāmu ibrāhīm ۖ wa man dakhalahu kāna āminā ۗ walillāhi `alan nāsi ḥijjul bayti manis-taṭā`a ilayhi sabīlā ۚ wa man kafara fa-innallāha ghaniyyun `anil `ālamīn

rows.arabic: قُلْ يَـٰٓأَهْلَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ لِمَ تَكْفُرُونَ بِـَٔايَـٰتِ ٱللَّهِ وَٱللَّهُ شَهِيدٌ عَلَىٰ مَا تَعْمَلُونَ
rows.translation: Say: O followers of the Book! why do you disbelieve in the communications of Allah? And Allah is a witness of what you do.
rows.transliteration: qul yā-ahlal-kitābi lima takfurūna bi-āyātillāhi wallāhu shahīdun `alā mā ta`malūn

rows.arabic: قُلْ يَـٰٓأَهْلَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ لِمَ تَصُدُّونَ عَن سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ مَنْ ءَامَنَ تَبْغُونَهَا عِوَجًا وَأَنتُمْ شُهَدَآءُ ۗ وَمَا ٱللَّهُ بِغَـٰفِلٍ عَمَّا تَعْمَلُونَ
rows.translation: Say: O followers of the Book! why do you hinder him who believes from the way of Allah? You seek (to make) it crooked, while you are witness, and Allah is not heedless of what you do.
rows.transliteration: qul yā-ahlal-kitābi lima taṣuddūna `an sabīlillāhi man āmana tabghūnahā `iwajan wa-antum shuhadā-u ۗ wa mallāhu bighāfilin `ammā ta`malūn

rows.arabic: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓا۟ إِن تُطِيعُوا۟ فَرِيقًا مِّنَ ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُوا۟ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ يَرُدُّوكُم بَعْدَ إِيمَـٰنِكُمْ كَـٰفِرِينَ
rows.translation: O you who believe! if you obey a party from among those who have been given the Book, they will turn you back as unbelievers after you have believed.
rows.transliteration: yā-ayyuhal ladhīna āmanū in tuṭī`ū farīqan minal ladhīna ūtul kitāba yaruddūkum ba`da-iymānikum kāfirīn

rows.arabic: وَكَيْفَ تَكْفُرُونَ وَأَنتُمْ تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْكُمْ ءَايَـٰتُ ٱللَّهِ وَفِيكُمْ رَسُولُهُۥ ۗ وَمَن يَعْتَصِم بِٱللَّهِ فَقَدْ هُدِىَ إِلَىٰ صِرَٰطٍ مُّسْتَقِيمٍ
rows.translation: But how can you disbelieve while it is you to whom the communications of Allah are recited, and among you is His Apostle? And whoever holds fast to Allah, he indeed is guided to the right path.
rows.transliteration: wakayfa takfurūna wa-antum tutlā `alaykum āyātullāhi wafīkum rasūluh ۗ wa man ya`taṣim billāhi faqad hudiya ilā ṣirāṭin mustaqīm

rows.arabic: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ ٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ حَقَّ تُقَاتِهِۦ وَلَا تَمُوتُنَّ إِلَّا وَأَنتُم مُّسْلِمُونَ
rows.translation: O you who believe! be careful of (your duty to) Allah with the care which is due to Him, and do not die unless you are Muslims.
rows.transliteration: yā-ayyuhal ladhīna āmanut-taqullāha ḥaqqa tuqātihi walā tamūtunna illā wa-antum muslimūn

rows.arabic: وَٱعْتَصِمُوا۟ بِحَبْلِ ٱللَّهِ جَمِيعًا وَلَا تَفَرَّقُوا۟ ۚ وَٱذْكُرُوا۟ نِعْمَتَ ٱللَّهِ عَلَيْكُمْ إِذْ كُنتُمْ أَعْدَآءً فَأَلَّفَ بَيْنَ قُلُوبِكُمْ فَأَصْبَحْتُم بِنِعْمَتِهِۦٓ إِخْوَٰنًا وَكُنتُمْ عَلَىٰ شَفَا حُفْرَةٍ مِّنَ ٱلنَّارِ فَأَنقَذَكُم مِّنْهَا ۗ كَذَٰلِكَ يُبَيِّنُ ٱللَّهُ لَكُمْ ءَايَـٰتِهِۦ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَهْتَدُونَ
rows.translation: And hold fast by the covenant of Allah all together and be not disunited, and remember the favor of Allah on you when you were enemies, then He united your hearts so by His favor you became brethren; and you were on the brink of a pit of fire, then He saved you from it, thus does Allah make clear to you His communications that you may follow the right way.
rows.transliteration: wa`taṣimū biḥablillāhi jamī`an walā tafarraqū ۚ wadhkurū ni`matallāhi `alaykum idh kuntum a`dā-an fa-allafa bayna qulūbikum fa-aṣbaḥtum bini`matihi ikhwānan wakuntum `alā shafā ḥufratim minan nāri fa-anqadhakum minhā ۗ kadhālika yubayyinullāhu lakum āyātihi la`allakum tahtadūn

rows.arabic: وَلْتَكُن مِّنكُمْ أُمَّةٌ يَدْعُونَ إِلَى ٱلْخَيْرِ وَيَأْمُرُونَ بِٱلْمَعْرُوفِ وَيَنْهَوْنَ عَنِ ٱلْمُنكَرِ ۚ وَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلْمُفْلِحُونَ
rows.translation: And from among you there should be a party who invite to good and enjoin what is right and forbid the wrong, and these it is that shall be successful.
rows.transliteration: waltakun minkum ummatun yad`ūna ilal-khayri waya-murūna bil ma`rūfi wayanhawna `anil munkar ۚ wa-ulā-ika humul mufliḥūn

rows.arabic: وَلَا تَكُونُوا۟ كَٱلَّذِينَ تَفَرَّقُوا۟ وَٱخْتَلَفُوا۟ مِنۢ بَعْدِ مَا جَآءَهُمُ ٱلْبَيِّنَـٰتُ ۚ وَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ لَهُمْ عَذَابٌ عَظِيمٌ
rows.translation: And be not like those who became divided and disagreed after clear arguments had come to them, and these it is that shall have a grievous chastisement.
rows.transliteration: walā takūnū kal ladhīna tafarraqū wakhtalafū min ba`di mā jā-ahumul bayyināt ۚ wa-ulā-ika lahum `adhābun `aẓīm

rows.arabic: يَوْمَ تَبْيَضُّ وُجُوهٌ وَتَسْوَدُّ وُجُوهٌ ۚ فَأَمَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ٱسْوَدَّتْ وُجُوهُهُمْ أَكَفَرْتُم بَعْدَ إِيمَـٰنِكُمْ فَذُوقُوا۟ ٱلْعَذَابَ بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَكْفُرُونَ
rows.translation: On the day when (some) faces shall turn white and (some) faces shall turn black; then as to those whose faces turn black: Did you disbelieve after your believing? Taste therefore the chastisement because you disbelieved.
rows.transliteration: yawma tabyaḍḍu wujūhun wataswaddu wujūh ۚ fa-ammal ladhīnas-waddat wujūhuhum akafartum ba`da-iymānikum fadhūqul `adhāba bimā kuntum takfurūn

rows.arabic: وَأَمَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ٱبْيَضَّتْ وُجُوهُهُمْ فَفِى رَحْمَةِ ٱللَّهِ هُمْ فِيهَا خَـٰلِدُونَ
rows.translation: And as to those whose faces turn white, they shall be in Allah's mercy; in it they shall-abide.
rows.transliteration: wa-ammal ladhīnab-yaḍḍat wujūhuhum fafī raḥmatil lāhi hum fīhā khālidūn

rows.arabic: تِلْكَ ءَايَـٰتُ ٱللَّهِ نَتْلُوهَا عَلَيْكَ بِٱلْحَقِّ ۗ وَمَا ٱللَّهُ يُرِيدُ ظُلْمًا لِّلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
rows.translation: These are the communications of Allah which We recite to you with truth, and Allah does not desire any injustice to the creatures.
rows.transliteration: tilka āyātullāhi natlūhā `alayka bil ḥaqq ۗ wa mallāhu yurīdu ẓul-mal lil`ālamīn

rows.arabic: وَلِلَّهِ مَا فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَمَا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ ۚ وَإِلَى ٱللَّهِ تُرْجَعُ ٱلْأُمُورُ
rows.translation: And whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth is Allah's; and to Allah all things return
rows.transliteration: walillāhi mā fis samāwāti wa mā fil-arḍ ۚ wa ilallāhi turja`ul-umūr

rows.arabic: كُنتُمْ خَيْرَ أُمَّةٍ أُخْرِجَتْ لِلنَّاسِ تَأْمُرُونَ بِٱلْمَعْرُوفِ وَتَنْهَوْنَ عَنِ ٱلْمُنكَرِ وَتُؤْمِنُونَ بِٱللَّهِ ۗ وَلَوْ ءَامَنَ أَهْلُ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ لَكَانَ خَيْرًا لَّهُم ۚ مِّنْهُمُ ٱلْمُؤْمِنُونَ وَأَكْثَرُهُمُ ٱلْفَـٰسِقُونَ
rows.translation: You are the best of the nations raised up for (the benefit of) men; you enjoin what is right and forbid the wrong and believe in Allah; and if the followers of the Book had believed it would have been better for them; of them (some) are believers and most of them are transgressors.
rows.transliteration: kuntum khayra ummatin ukhrijat linnāsi ta-murūna bil ma`rūfi watanhawna `anil munkari watu-minūna billāh ۗ walaw āmana ahlul kitābi lakāna khayral lahum ۚ minhumul mu-minūna wa-aktharuhumul fāsiqūn

rows.arabic: لَن يَضُرُّوكُمْ إِلَّآ أَذًى ۖ وَإِن يُقَـٰتِلُوكُمْ يُوَلُّوكُمُ ٱلْأَدْبَارَ ثُمَّ لَا يُنصَرُونَ
rows.translation: They shall by no means harm you but with a slight evil; and if they fight with you they shall turn (their) backs to you, then shall they not be helped.
rows.transliteration: lan yaḍurrūkum illā adhā ۖ wa in yuqātilūkum yuwallūkumul-adbāra thumma lā yunṣarūn

rows.arabic: ضُرِبَتْ عَلَيْهِمُ ٱلذِّلَّةُ أَيْنَ مَا ثُقِفُوٓا۟ إِلَّا بِحَبْلٍ مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ وَحَبْلٍ مِّنَ ٱلنَّاسِ وَبَآءُو بِغَضَبٍ مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ وَضُرِبَتْ عَلَيْهِمُ ٱلْمَسْكَنَةُ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُمْ كَانُوا۟ يَكْفُرُونَ بِـَٔايَـٰتِ ٱللَّهِ وَيَقْتُلُونَ ٱلْأَنۢبِيَآءَ بِغَيْرِ حَقٍّ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ بِمَا عَصَوا۟ وَّكَانُوا۟ يَعْتَدُونَ
rows.translation: Abasement is made to cleave to them wherever they are found, except under a covenant with Allah and a covenant with men, and they have become deserving of wrath from Allah, and humiliation is made to cleave to them; this is because they disbelieved in the communications of Allah and slew the prophets unjustly; this is because they disobeyed and exceeded the limits.
rows.transliteration: ḍuribat `alayhimudh dhillatu ayna mā thuqifū illā biḥablin minallāhi waḥablin minan nāsi wabā-ū bighaḍabin minallāhi waḍuribat `alayhimul maskanah ۚ dhālika bi-annahum kānū yakfurūna bi-āyātillāhi wayaqtulūnal-anbiyā-a bighayri ḥaqq ۚ dhālika bimā `aṣaw wakānū ya`tadūn

rows.arabic: لَيْسُوا۟ سَوَآءً ۗ مِّنْ أَهْلِ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ أُمَّةٌ قَآئِمَةٌ يَتْلُونَ ءَايَـٰتِ ٱللَّهِ ءَانَآءَ ٱلَّيْلِ وَهُمْ يَسْجُدُونَ
rows.translation: They are not all alike; of the followers of the Book there is an upright party; they recite Allah's communications in the nighttime and they adore (Him).
rows.transliteration: laysū sawā-ā ۗ min ahlil kitābi ummatun qā-imatun yatlūna āyātillāhi ānā-al layli wahum yasjudūn

rows.arabic: يُؤْمِنُونَ بِٱللَّهِ وَٱلْيَوْمِ ٱلْـَٔاخِرِ وَيَأْمُرُونَ بِٱلْمَعْرُوفِ وَيَنْهَوْنَ عَنِ ٱلْمُنكَرِ وَيُسَـٰرِعُونَ فِى ٱلْخَيْرَٰتِ وَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ مِنَ ٱلصَّـٰلِحِينَ
rows.translation: They believe in Allah and the last day, and they enjoin what is right and forbid the wrong and they strive with one another in hastening to good deeds, and those are among the good.
rows.transliteration: yu-minūna billāhi wal yawmil-ākhiri waya-murūna bil ma`rūfi wayanhawna `anil munkari wayusāri`ūna fil khayrāti wa-ulā-ika minaṣ ṣāliḥīn

rows.arabic: وَمَا يَفْعَلُوا۟ مِنْ خَيْرٍ فَلَن يُكْفَرُوهُ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ عَلِيمٌۢ بِٱلْمُتَّقِينَ
rows.translation: And whatever good they do, they shall not be denied it, and Allah knows those who guard (against evil).
rows.transliteration: wa mā yaf`alū min khayrin falan yukfarūh ۗ wallāhu `alīmun bil muttaqīn

rows.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لَن تُغْنِىَ عَنْهُمْ أَمْوَٰلُهُمْ وَلَآ أَوْلَـٰدُهُم مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ شَيْـًٔا ۖ وَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ أَصْحَـٰبُ ٱلنَّارِ ۚ هُمْ فِيهَا خَـٰلِدُونَ
rows.translation: (As for) those who disbelieve, surely neither their wealth nor their children shall avail them in the least against Allah; and these are the inmates of the fire; therein they shall abide.
rows.transliteration: innal ladhīna kafarū lan tughniya `anhum amwāluhum walā awlāduhum minallāhi shay-ā ۖ wa-ulā-ika aṣ-ḥābun nār ۚ hum fīhā khālidūn

rows.arabic: مَثَلُ مَا يُنفِقُونَ فِى هَـٰذِهِ ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا كَمَثَلِ رِيحٍ فِيهَا صِرٌّ أَصَابَتْ حَرْثَ قَوْمٍ ظَلَمُوٓا۟ أَنفُسَهُمْ فَأَهْلَكَتْهُ ۚ وَمَا ظَلَمَهُمُ ٱللَّهُ وَلَـٰكِنْ أَنفُسَهُمْ يَظْلِمُونَ
rows.translation: The likeness of what they spend in the life of this world is as the likeness of wind in which is intense cold (that) smites the seed produce of a people who have done injustice to their souls and destroys it; and Allah is not unjust to them, but they are unjust to themselves.
rows.transliteration: mathalu mā yunfiqūna fī hādhihil ḥayātid dunyā kamathali rīḥin fīhā ṣirrun aṣābat ḥartha qawmin ẓalamū anfusahum fa-ahlakat-h ۚ wa mā ẓalamahumullāhu walākin anfusahum yaẓlimūn

rows.arabic: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ لَا تَتَّخِذُوا۟ بِطَانَةً مِّن دُونِكُمْ لَا يَأْلُونَكُمْ خَبَالًا وَدُّوا۟ مَا عَنِتُّمْ قَدْ بَدَتِ ٱلْبَغْضَآءُ مِنْ أَفْوَٰهِهِمْ وَمَا تُخْفِى صُدُورُهُمْ أَكْبَرُ ۚ قَدْ بَيَّنَّا لَكُمُ ٱلْـَٔايَـٰتِ ۖ إِن كُنتُمْ تَعْقِلُونَ
rows.translation: O you who believe! do not take for intimate friends from among others than your own people; they do not fall short of inflicting loss upon you; they love what distresses you; vehement hatred has already appeared from out of their mouths, and what their breasts conceal is greater still; indeed, We have made the communications clear to you, if you will understand.
rows.transliteration: yā-ayyuhal ladhīna āmanū lā tattakhidhū biṭānatan min dūnikum lā ya-lūnakum khabālan waddū mā `anittum qad badatil baghḍā-u min afwāhihim wa mā tukhfī ṣudūruhum akbar ۚ qad bayyannā lakumul-āyāt ۖ in kuntum ta`qilūn

rows.arabic: هَـٰٓأَنتُمْ أُو۟لَآءِ تُحِبُّونَهُمْ وَلَا يُحِبُّونَكُمْ وَتُؤْمِنُونَ بِٱلْكِتَـٰبِ كُلِّهِۦ وَإِذَا لَقُوكُمْ قَالُوٓا۟ ءَامَنَّا وَإِذَا خَلَوْا۟ عَضُّوا۟ عَلَيْكُمُ ٱلْأَنَامِلَ مِنَ ٱلْغَيْظِ ۚ قُلْ مُوتُوا۟ بِغَيْظِكُمْ ۗ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ عَلِيمٌۢ بِذَاتِ ٱلصُّدُورِ
rows.translation: Lo! you are they who will love them while they do not love you, and you believe in the Book (in) the whole of it; and when they meet you they say: We believe, and when they are alone, they bite the ends of their fingers in rage against you. Say: Die in your rage; surely Allah knows what is in the breasts.
rows.transliteration: hā-antum ulā-i tuḥibbūnahum walā yuḥibbūnakum watu-minūna bil kitābi kullihi wa idhā laqūkum qālū āmannā wa idhā khalaw `aḍḍū `alaykumul-anāmila minal ghayẓ ۚ qul mūtū bighayẓikum ۗ innallāha `alīmun bidhātiṣ ṣudūr

rows.arabic: إِن تَمْسَسْكُمْ حَسَنَةٌ تَسُؤْهُمْ وَإِن تُصِبْكُمْ سَيِّئَةٌ يَفْرَحُوا۟ بِهَا ۖ وَإِن تَصْبِرُوا۟ وَتَتَّقُوا۟ لَا يَضُرُّكُمْ كَيْدُهُمْ شَيْـًٔا ۗ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ بِمَا يَعْمَلُونَ مُحِيطٌ
rows.translation: If good befalls you, it grieves them, and if an evil afflicts you, they rejoice at it; and if you are patient and guard yourselves, their scheme will not injure you in any way; surely Allah comprehends what they do.
rows.transliteration: in tamsaskum ḥasanatun tasu-hum wa in tuṣibkum sayyi-atun yafraḥū bihā ۖ wa in taṣbirū watattaqū lā yaḍurrukum kayduhum shay-ā ۗ innallāha bimā ya`malūna muḥīṭ

rows.arabic: وَإِذْ غَدَوْتَ مِنْ أَهْلِكَ تُبَوِّئُ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ مَقَـٰعِدَ لِلْقِتَالِ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ سَمِيعٌ عَلِيمٌ
rows.translation: And when you did go forth early in the morning from your family to lodge the believers in encampments for war and Allah is Hearing, Knowing.
rows.transliteration: wa idh ghadawta min ahlika tubawwi-ul mu-minīna maqā`ida lilqitāl ۗ wallāhu samī`un `alīm

rows.arabic: إِذْ هَمَّت طَّآئِفَتَانِ مِنكُمْ أَن تَفْشَلَا وَٱللَّهُ وَلِيُّهُمَا ۗ وَعَلَى ٱللَّهِ فَلْيَتَوَكَّلِ ٱلْمُؤْمِنُونَ
rows.translation: When two parties from among you had determined that they should show cowardice, and Allah was the guardian of them both, and in Allah should the believers trust.
rows.transliteration: idh hammat ṭā-ifatāni minkum an tafshalā wallāhu waliyyuhumā ۗ wa`alallāhi falyatawakkalil mu-minūn

rows.arabic: وَلَقَدْ نَصَرَكُمُ ٱللَّهُ بِبَدْرٍ وَأَنتُمْ أَذِلَّةٌ ۖ فَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَشْكُرُونَ
rows.translation: And Allah did certainly assist you at Badr when you were weak; be careful of (your duty to) Allah then, that you may give thanks.
rows.transliteration: walaqad naṣarakumullāhu bibadrin wa-antum adhillah ۖ fattaqullāha la`allakum tashkurūn

rows.arabic: إِذْ تَقُولُ لِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ أَلَن يَكْفِيَكُمْ أَن يُمِدَّكُمْ رَبُّكُم بِثَلَـٰثَةِ ءَالَـٰفٍ مِّنَ ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةِ مُنزَلِينَ
rows.translation: When you said to the believers: Does it not suffice you that your Lord should assist you with three thousand of the angels sent down?
rows.transliteration: idh taqūlu lil-mu-minīna alan yakfiyakum an yumiddakum rabbukum bithalāthati ālāfin minal malā-ikati munzalīn

rows.arabic: بَلَىٰٓ ۚ إِن تَصْبِرُوا۟ وَتَتَّقُوا۟ وَيَأْتُوكُم مِّن فَوْرِهِمْ هَـٰذَا يُمْدِدْكُمْ رَبُّكُم بِخَمْسَةِ ءَالَـٰفٍ مِّنَ ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةِ مُسَوِّمِينَ
rows.translation: Yea! if you remain patient and are on your guard, and they come upon you in a headlong manner, your Lord will assist you with five thousand of the havoc-making angels.
rows.transliteration: balā ۚ in taṣbirū watattaqū waya-tūkum min fawrihim hādhā yumdidkum rabbukum bikhamsati ālāfin minal malā-ikati musawwimīn

rows.arabic: وَمَا جَعَلَهُ ٱللَّهُ إِلَّا بُشْرَىٰ لَكُمْ وَلِتَطْمَئِنَّ قُلُوبُكُم بِهِۦ ۗ وَمَا ٱلنَّصْرُ إِلَّا مِنْ عِندِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلْعَزِيزِ ٱلْحَكِيمِ
rows.translation: And Allah did not make it but as good news for you, and that your hearts might be at ease thereby, and victory is only from Allah, the Mighty, the Wise.
rows.transliteration: wa mā ja`alahullāhu illā bushrā lakum walitaṭma-inna qulūbukum bih ۗ wa man naṣru illā min `indillāhil `azīzil ḥakīm

rows.arabic: لِيَقْطَعَ طَرَفًا مِّنَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوٓا۟ أَوْ يَكْبِتَهُمْ فَيَنقَلِبُوا۟ خَآئِبِينَ
rows.translation: That He may cut off a portion from among those who disbelieve, or abase them so that they should return disappointed of attaining what they desired.
rows.transliteration: liyaqṭa`a ṭarafan minal ladhīna kafarū aw yakbitahum fayanqalibū khā-ibīn

rows.arabic: لَيْسَ لَكَ مِنَ ٱلْأَمْرِ شَىْءٌ أَوْ يَتُوبَ عَلَيْهِمْ أَوْ يُعَذِّبَهُمْ فَإِنَّهُمْ ظَـٰلِمُونَ
rows.translation: You have no concern in the affair whether He turns to them (mercifully) or chastises them, for surely they are unjust.
rows.transliteration: laysa laka minal-amri shay-un aw yatūba `alayhim aw yu`adhhibahum fa-innahum ẓālimūn

rows.arabic: وَلِلَّهِ مَا فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَمَا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ ۚ يَغْفِرُ لِمَن يَشَآءُ وَيُعَذِّبُ مَن يَشَآءُ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ غَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ
rows.translation: And whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth is Allah's; He forgives whom He pleases and chastises whom He pleases; and Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.
rows.transliteration: walillāhi mā fis samāwāti wa mā fil-arḍ ۚ yaghfiru liman yashā-u wayu`adhhibu man yashā-u ۚ wallāhu ghafūrun raḥīm

rows.arabic: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ لَا تَأْكُلُوا۟ ٱلرِّبَوٰٓا۟ أَضْعَـٰفًا مُّضَـٰعَفَةً ۖ وَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ لَعَلَّكُمْ تُفْلِحُونَ
rows.translation: O you who believe! do not devour usury, making it double and redouble, and be careful of (your duty to) Allah, that you may be successful.
rows.transliteration: yā-ayyuhal ladhīna āmanū lā ta-kulur ribā aḍ`āfan muḍā`afah ۖ wattaqullāha la`allakum tufliḥūn

rows.arabic: وَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱلنَّارَ ٱلَّتِىٓ أُعِدَّتْ لِلْكَـٰفِرِينَ
rows.translation: And guard yourselves against the fire which has been prepared for the unbelievers.
rows.transliteration: wattaqun nāral latī u`iddat lilkāfirīn

rows.arabic: وَأَطِيعُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَٱلرَّسُولَ لَعَلَّكُمْ تُرْحَمُونَ
rows.translation: And obey Allah and the Apostle, that you may be shown mercy.
rows.transliteration: wa-aṭī`ullāha war rasūla la`allakum turḥamūn

rows.arabic: وَسَارِعُوٓا۟ إِلَىٰ مَغْفِرَةٍ مِّن رَّبِّكُمْ وَجَنَّةٍ عَرْضُهَا ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتُ وَٱلْأَرْضُ أُعِدَّتْ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ
rows.translation: And hasten to forgiveness from your Lord; and a Garden, the extensiveness of which is (as) the heavens and the earth, it is prepared for those who guard (against evil).
rows.transliteration: wasāri`ū ilā maghfiratim min rabbikum wajannatin `arḍuhas samāwātu wal-arḍu u`iddat lil-muttaqīn

rows.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ يُنفِقُونَ فِى ٱلسَّرَّآءِ وَٱلضَّرَّآءِ وَٱلْكَـٰظِمِينَ ٱلْغَيْظَ وَٱلْعَافِينَ عَنِ ٱلنَّاسِ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ يُحِبُّ ٱلْمُحْسِنِينَ
rows.translation: Those who spend (benevolently) in ease as well as in straitness, and those who restrain (their) anger and pardon men; and Allah loves the doers of good (to others).
rows.transliteration: alladhīna yunfiqūna fis sarrā-i waḍ ḍarrā-i wal kāẓimīnal ghayẓa wal `āfīna `anin nās ۗ wallāhu yuḥibbul muḥsinīn

rows.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ إِذَا فَعَلُوا۟ فَـٰحِشَةً أَوْ ظَلَمُوٓا۟ أَنفُسَهُمْ ذَكَرُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ فَٱسْتَغْفَرُوا۟ لِذُنُوبِهِمْ وَمَن يَغْفِرُ ٱلذُّنُوبَ إِلَّا ٱللَّهُ وَلَمْ يُصِرُّوا۟ عَلَىٰ مَا فَعَلُوا۟ وَهُمْ يَعْلَمُونَ
rows.translation: And those who when they commit an indecency or do injustice to their souls remember Allah and ask forgiveness for their faults-- and who forgives the faults but Allah, and (who) do not knowingly persist in what they have done.
rows.transliteration: wal ladhīna idhā fa`alū fāḥishatan aw ẓalamū anfusahum dhakarullāha fastaghfarū lidhunūbihim wa man yaghfirudh dhunūba illallāhu walam yuṣirrū `alā mā fa`alū wahum ya`lamūn

rows.arabic: أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ جَزَآؤُهُم مَّغْفِرَةٌ مِّن رَّبِّهِمْ وَجَنَّـٰتٌ تَجْرِى مِن تَحْتِهَا ٱلْأَنْهَـٰرُ خَـٰلِدِينَ فِيهَا ۚ وَنِعْمَ أَجْرُ ٱلْعَـٰمِلِينَ
rows.translation: (As for) these-- their reward is forgiveness from their Lord, and gardens beneath which rivers flow, to abide in them, and excellent is the reward of the laborers.
rows.transliteration: ulā-ika jazā-uhum maghfiratun min rabbihim wajannātun tajrī min taḥtihal-anhāru khālidīna fīhā ۚ wani`ma ajrul `āmilīn

rows.arabic: قَدْ خَلَتْ مِن قَبْلِكُمْ سُنَنٌ فَسِيرُوا۟ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ فَٱنظُرُوا۟ كَيْفَ كَانَ عَـٰقِبَةُ ٱلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
rows.translation: Indeed there have been examples before you; therefore travel in the earth and see what was the end of the rejecters.
rows.transliteration: qad khalat min qablikum sunanun fasīrū fil-arḍi fanẓurū kayfa kāna `āqibatul mukadhhibīn

rows.arabic: هَـٰذَا بَيَانٌ لِّلنَّاسِ وَهُدًى وَمَوْعِظَةٌ لِّلْمُتَّقِينَ
rows.translation: This is a clear statement for men, and a guidance and an admonition to those who guard (against evil).
rows.transliteration: hādhā bayānul linnāsi wahudan wa maw`iẓatun lil-muttaqīn

rows.arabic: وَلَا تَهِنُوا۟ وَلَا تَحْزَنُوا۟ وَأَنتُمُ ٱلْأَعْلَوْنَ إِن كُنتُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
rows.translation: And be not infirm, and be not grieving, and you shall have the upper hand if you are believers.
rows.transliteration: walā tahinū walā taḥzanū wa-antumul-a`lawna in kuntum mu-minīn

rows.arabic: إِن يَمْسَسْكُمْ قَرْحٌ فَقَدْ مَسَّ ٱلْقَوْمَ قَرْحٌ مِّثْلُهُۥ ۚ وَتِلْكَ ٱلْأَيَّامُ نُدَاوِلُهَا بَيْنَ ٱلنَّاسِ وَلِيَعْلَمَ ٱللَّهُ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَيَتَّخِذَ مِنكُمْ شُهَدَآءَ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ لَا يُحِبُّ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
rows.translation: If a wound has afflicted you (at Ohud), a wound like it has also afflicted the (unbelieving) people; and We bring these days to men by turns, and that Allah may know those who believe and take witnesses from among you; and Allah does not love the unjust.
rows.transliteration: in yamsaskum qarḥun faqad massal qawma qarḥun mithluh ۚ watilkal-ayyāmu nudāwiluhā baynan nāsi waliya`lamallāhul ladhīna āmanū wayattakhidha minkum shuhadā-a ۗ wallāhu lā yuḥibbuẓ ẓālimīn

rows.arabic: وَلِيُمَحِّصَ ٱللَّهُ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَيَمْحَقَ ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ
rows.translation: And that He may purge those who believe and deprive the unbelievers of blessings.
rows.transliteration: waliyumaḥḥiṣallāhul ladhīna āmanū wayamḥaqal kāfirīn

rows.arabic: أَمْ حَسِبْتُمْ أَن تَدْخُلُوا۟ ٱلْجَنَّةَ وَلَمَّا يَعْلَمِ ٱللَّهُ ٱلَّذِينَ جَـٰهَدُوا۟ مِنكُمْ وَيَعْلَمَ ٱلصَّـٰبِرِينَ
rows.translation: Do you think that you will enter the garden while Allah has not yet known those who strive hard from among you, and (He has not) known the patient.
rows.transliteration: am ḥasibtum an tadkhulul jannata walammā ya`lamillāhul ladhīna jāhadū minkum waya`lamaṣ ṣābirīn

rows.arabic: وَلَقَدْ كُنتُمْ تَمَنَّوْنَ ٱلْمَوْتَ مِن قَبْلِ أَن تَلْقَوْهُ فَقَدْ رَأَيْتُمُوهُ وَأَنتُمْ تَنظُرُونَ
rows.translation: And certainly you desired death before you met it, so indeed you have seen it and you look (at it)
rows.transliteration: walaqad kuntum tamannawnal mawta min qabli an talqawhu faqad ra-aytumūhu wa-antum tanẓurūn

rows.arabic: وَمَا مُحَمَّدٌ إِلَّا رَسُولٌ قَدْ خَلَتْ مِن قَبْلِهِ ٱلرُّسُلُ ۚ أَفَإِي۟ن مَّاتَ أَوْ قُتِلَ ٱنقَلَبْتُمْ عَلَىٰٓ أَعْقَـٰبِكُمْ ۚ وَمَن يَنقَلِبْ عَلَىٰ عَقِبَيْهِ فَلَن يَضُرَّ ٱللَّهَ شَيْـًٔا ۗ وَسَيَجْزِى ٱللَّهُ ٱلشَّـٰكِرِينَ
rows.translation: And Muhammad is no more than an apostle; the apostles have already passed away before him; if then he dies or is killed will you turn back upon your heels? And whoever turns back upon his heels, he will by no means do harm to Allah in the least and Allah will reward the grateful.
rows.transliteration: wa mā muḥammadun illā rasūlun qad khalat min qablihir rusul ۚ afa-in māta aw qutilan-qalabtum `alā a`qābikum ۚ wa man yanqalib `alā `aqibayhi falan yaḍurrallāha shay-ā ۗ wasayajzillāhush shākirīn

rows.arabic: وَمَا كَانَ لِنَفْسٍ أَن تَمُوتَ إِلَّا بِإِذْنِ ٱللَّهِ كِتَـٰبًا مُّؤَجَّلًا ۗ وَمَن يُرِدْ ثَوَابَ ٱلدُّنْيَا نُؤْتِهِۦ مِنْهَا وَمَن يُرِدْ ثَوَابَ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ نُؤْتِهِۦ مِنْهَا ۚ وَسَنَجْزِى ٱلشَّـٰكِرِينَ
rows.translation: And a soul will not die but with the permission of Allah the term is fixed; and whoever desires the reward of this world, I shall give him of it, and whoever desires the reward of the hereafter I shall give him of it, and I will reward the grateful.
rows.transliteration: wa mā kāna linafsin an tamūta illā bi-idhnillāhi kitāban mu-ajjalā ۗ wa man yurid thawābad dunyā nu-tihi minhā wa man yurid thawābal-ākhirati nu-tihi minhā ۚ wasanajzish shākirīn

rows.arabic: وَكَأَيِّن مِّن نَّبِىٍّ قَـٰتَلَ مَعَهُۥ رِبِّيُّونَ كَثِيرٌ فَمَا وَهَنُوا۟ لِمَآ أَصَابَهُمْ فِى سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ وَمَا ضَعُفُوا۟ وَمَا ٱسْتَكَانُوا۟ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ يُحِبُّ ٱلصَّـٰبِرِينَ
rows.translation: And how many a prophet has fought with whom were many worshippers of the Lord; so they did not become weak-hearted on account of what befell them in Allah's way, nor did they weaken, nor did they abase themselves; and Allah loves the patient.
rows.transliteration: waka-ayyin min nabiyyin qātala ma`ahu ribbiyyūna kathīrun famā wahanū limā aṣābahum fī sabīlillāhi wa mā ḍa`ufū wa mas-takānū ۗ wallāhu yuḥibbuṣ ṣābirīn

rows.arabic: وَمَا كَانَ قَوْلَهُمْ إِلَّآ أَن قَالُوا۟ رَبَّنَا ٱغْفِرْ لَنَا ذُنُوبَنَا وَإِسْرَافَنَا فِىٓ أَمْرِنَا وَثَبِّتْ أَقْدَامَنَا وَٱنصُرْنَا عَلَى ٱلْقَوْمِ ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ
rows.translation: And their saying was no other than that they said: Our Lord! forgive us our faults and our extravagance in our affair and make firm our feet and help us against the unbelieving people.
rows.transliteration: wa mā kāna qawlahum illā an qālū rabbanagh-fir lanā dhunūbanā wa isrāfanā fī amrinā wathabbit aqdāmanā wanṣurnā `alal-qawmil kāfirīn

rows.arabic: فَـَٔاتَىٰهُمُ ٱللَّهُ ثَوَابَ ٱلدُّنْيَا وَحُسْنَ ثَوَابِ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ يُحِبُّ ٱلْمُحْسِنِينَ
rows.translation: So Allah gave them the reward of this world and better reward of the hereafter and Allah loves those who do good (to others).
rows.transliteration: fa-ātāhumullāhu thawābad dunyā waḥusna thawābil-ākhirah ۗ wallāhu yuḥibbul muḥsinīn

rows.arabic: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓا۟ إِن تُطِيعُوا۟ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ يَرُدُّوكُمْ عَلَىٰٓ أَعْقَـٰبِكُمْ فَتَنقَلِبُوا۟ خَـٰسِرِينَ
rows.translation: O you who believe! if you obey those who disbelieve they will turn you back upon your heels, so you will turn back losers.
rows.transliteration: yā-ayyuhal ladhīna āmanū in tuṭī`ul ladhīna kafarū yaruddūkum `alā a`qābikum fatanqalibū khāsirīn

rows.arabic: بَلِ ٱللَّهُ مَوْلَىٰكُمْ ۖ وَهُوَ خَيْرُ ٱلنَّـٰصِرِينَ
rows.translation: Nay! Allah is your Patron and He is the best of the helpers.
rows.transliteration: balillāhu mawlākum ۖ wahuwa khayrun nāṣirīn

rows.arabic: سَنُلْقِى فِى قُلُوبِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ ٱلرُّعْبَ بِمَآ أَشْرَكُوا۟ بِٱللَّهِ مَا لَمْ يُنَزِّلْ بِهِۦ سُلْطَـٰنًا ۖ وَمَأْوَىٰهُمُ ٱلنَّارُ ۚ وَبِئْسَ مَثْوَى ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
rows.translation: We will cast terror into the hearts of those who disbelieve, because they set up with Allah that for which He has sent down no authority, and their abode is the fire, and evil is the abode of the unjust.
rows.transliteration: sanulqī fī qulūbil ladhīna kafarur ru`ba bimā ashrakū billāhi mā lam yunazzil bihi sulṭānā ۖ wa ma-wāhumun nār ۚ wabi-sa mathwaẓ ẓālimīn

rows.arabic: وَلَقَدْ صَدَقَكُمُ ٱللَّهُ وَعْدَهُۥٓ إِذْ تَحُسُّونَهُم بِإِذْنِهِۦ ۖ حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا فَشِلْتُمْ وَتَنَـٰزَعْتُمْ فِى ٱلْأَمْرِ وَعَصَيْتُم مِّنۢ بَعْدِ مَآ أَرَىٰكُم مَّا تُحِبُّونَ ۚ مِنكُم مَّن يُرِيدُ ٱلدُّنْيَا وَمِنكُم مَّن يُرِيدُ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةَ ۚ ثُمَّ صَرَفَكُمْ عَنْهُمْ لِيَبْتَلِيَكُمْ ۖ وَلَقَدْ عَفَا عَنكُمْ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ ذُو فَضْلٍ عَلَى ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
rows.translation: And certainly Allah made good to you His promise when you slew them by His permission, until when you became weak-hearted and disputed about the affair and disobeyed after He had shown you that which you loved; of you were some who desired this world and of you were some who desired the hereafter; then He turned you away from them that He might try you; and He has certainly pardoned you, and Allah is Gracious to the believers.
rows.transliteration: walaqad ṣadaqakumullāhu wa`dahu idh taḥussūnahum bi-idhnih ۖ ḥattā idhā fashiltum watanāza`tum fil-amri wa`aṣaytum min ba`di mā arākum mā tuḥibbūn ۚ minkum man yurīdud dunyā wa minkum man yurīdul-ākhirah ۚ thumma ṣarafakum `anhum liyabtaliyakum ۖ walaqad `afā `ankum ۗ wallāhu dhū faḍlin `alal-mu-minīn

rows.arabic: إِذْ تُصْعِدُونَ وَلَا تَلْوُۥنَ عَلَىٰٓ أَحَدٍ وَٱلرَّسُولُ يَدْعُوكُمْ فِىٓ أُخْرَىٰكُمْ فَأَثَـٰبَكُمْ غَمًّۢا بِغَمٍّ لِّكَيْلَا تَحْزَنُوا۟ عَلَىٰ مَا فَاتَكُمْ وَلَا مَآ أَصَـٰبَكُمْ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ خَبِيرٌۢ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ
rows.translation: When you ran off precipitately and did not wait for any one, and the Apostle was calling you from your rear, so He gave you another sorrow instead of (your) sorrow, so that you might not grieve at what had escaped you, nor (at) what befell you; and Allah is aware of what you do.
rows.transliteration: idh tuṣ`idūna walā talwūna `alā aḥadin war rasūlu yad`ūkum fī ukhrākum fa-athābakum ghamman bighammin likaylā taḥzanū `alā mā fātakum walā mā aṣābakum ۗ wallāhu khabīrun bimā ta`malūn
